name: Mackinaw Valley Vineyard
description: Mackinaw Valley Vineyard and Winery, founded by Paul Hahn, is a year round destination located conveniently about a 20 to 30 minute drive from Peoria, East Peoria, Bloomington-Normal, Pekin, Morton, Lincoln, Washington and Eureka. The 86 acre property is a working vineyard and winery situated on a glacial moraine with a 30 mile view from our tasting room and decks. The vineyard features daily wine tasting, a gift shop with wine themed gifts and local foodie favorites like Ropp Jersey Cheese and Chocolatier Confection chocolates. We host numerous concerts, festivals, murder mystery dinners, trivia game nights and fun tours and chocolate and wine tastings. Visitors often tell us they feel that they’ve been on a mini-vacation when they visit the vineyard and taste our award winning wines. Come and experience one of Illinois’s most picturesque destinations or as we like to say, “Wine country in our own backyard” - All the Best, Diane Hahn and Family.

name: Tres Rojas Winery
address: 1774 E Cruger Rd, Washington, IL 61571, USA
description: At the end of a winding road, on top of a breezy hill, find Tres Rojas Winery. This 51 acre Vineyard and Tasting Room sits on the edge of Washington but feels like it's miles away from the hustle of life. Relax with family and friends on the patio or in the tasting room. A large seating area is also available to host private events. The wine menu boasts award winning wines from dry to sweet, red to white, and fruit wines - something for everyone. Enjoy a wine tasting at the bar, by the bottle, a glass, or in a flight. Pizzas, cheeses, chocolates and snacks are available for purchase. Guests are welcome to bring their own foods to enjoy. A small selection of beers and soda are also available. Music on the Patio is scheduled every Sunday afternoon May through September. Check out all the events on the webpage or on Facebook - there are a wide variety of fun things to do. Come out and find your favorite wine today!

name: Pavillion on the Lagoon at Mineral Springs Park
description: This beautiful 100+ year old building serves as the focal point of our community and is available for your group, family or organization's use.

name: Glen Oak Park
description:
Make Glen Oak Park a daylong destination for you and your family! Packed with fun, the Park is home to Peoria Zoo, the Peoria PlayHouse Children’s Museum, Luthy Botanical Garden, and Rotary Adventure Grove, Glen Oak Amphitheatre and Glen Park Lagoon. And that’s just the beginning of the fun you can have…The roads through Glen Oak Park also provide paved, but not so level hiking opportunities.

If you have questions about rentals at this park, please call 309-682-1200.

name: Forest Park Nature Center
description:
This 500-acre Illinois Nature Preserve offers 7 miles of hiking trails with all ranges of difficulty. The center also features a natural history museum, spacious bird watching room, nature hikes, guided walks and a nature store.

Do you enjoy bird watching or hiking? Forest Park Nature Center is for you! Forest Park Nature Center offers seven miles of trails for hiking and nature enjoyment and is home to a gift shop that carries bird feeding and hiking necessities. Interested in learning more about nature and all that it entails? Forest Park Nature Center has classes for adults and children alike, covering topics from bats to bugs and everything in between. Guided hiking tours are also available.

name: Wildlife Prairie Park
address: 3826 N. Taylor Rd. Hanna City , IL 61536
description:
The Park has been referred to as a jewel in the North American Midwest. We have also been listed as a top 10 destination to visit in Illinois. Located just outside of Peoria, IL, this 1800-acre zoological park is home to 60 different species and over 150 animals that are or were all native to the area. Our guests come to learn about and see wolves, bison, waterfowl, black bears, elk, otters, badgers, snakes, bobcats and more! 

You will enjoy the park’s spectacular natural landscapes, natural wildlife viewing, and more throughout all seasons of the year. There is something for all ages and stages at Wildlife Prairie Park …your adventure awaits!

Wildlife Prairie Park Accommodations: 13 unique lodging rooms ranging from Santa Fe Train Cabooses to grain bins and traditional rooms, all of which are non-smoking. 20 primitive tent camping sites with a fire ring and picnic table at each. All lodging guests have access to the recreation room with showers, bathrooms, vending and games for kids. 

Meeting Space:  Our available event spaces and lodging provide the backdrop for once-in-a-lifetime wedding celebrations, holiday parties, corporate events, school events and quarterly retreats. 10,970 sq. ft. of total meeting space. 

Number of meeting rooms: 5 

Largest meeting room: 4,800 sq. ft. 

Banquet capacity: 50-250 with trails for nature walks, fishing, biking & hiking

name: Wheels O' Time Museum
description:
The Wheels O’ Time Museum recently added a new, large exhibit building to its campus, joining the additional five large structures. The new exhibit building includes a military display with a Korean War-era "Grasshopper" reconnaissance plane, jeeps and uniforms; several vintage Caterpillar tractors; a textile exhibit; a Christmas through time display and a rotating display from the Peoria Historical Society.

The museum’s exhibits include interactive and educational materials for all ages from antique and collector cars to a steam locomotive and trains, farm and Caterpillar equipment, a restored LeTourneau Steel House, fire trucks, airplanes, bicycles, vintage clothing, and many more exhibitions for the enjoyment of kids and adults alike.

The museum is open to the public from May to October. Maintenance and exhibition updates continue during the other six months of the year.

name: The 12Bar Lounge
description:
Peoria Heights’ newest music, lounge, and rooftop bar! Chef Dustin Allen has accomplished the art of mixing food, drink, and music! Come on up to the third floor grab a drink, some food, and enjoy the view!

The Twelve Bar, Peoria Heights’ newest music, wine and cocktail bar, offers a comfortable, intimate space where you can drop by for a cocktail or make an evening of it with our ever-evolving small plates & tapas menu, a nice bottle of wine, and/or something from our curated craft beer list. Plan on music every weekend beginning this spring (jazz groups, folk artists, blues & roots, songwriter series and more), with plenty of improv (by top area musicians, our award-winning bar manager and, of course, Edge’s kitchen staff). The Twelve Bar will feature free-form music, food and drink at all times. No performance will be the same as the last.

Located on the 3rd floor of 4500 Building above Edge, by Chef Dustin Allen

name: Sucre Sweets and Socials
description:
The idea of Sucré Sweets and Socials began when the owners envisioned a modern, upbeat, big city feel, family-friendly mobile trolley with yummy treats that make customers feel like they are biting into a unique and exciting experience with a nostalgic flair.

The business is owned and operated by local Mortonites, Keely and Ryan LeTourneau. Sucré opened in Fall of 2017 and has quickly become a favorite in Central Illinois for a fun family atmosphere to grab sweet treats and enjoy a great time with family and friends.

name: Russell's Cycling & Fitness
description: Russell's Cycling & Fitness was established in 1977 in the garage of Joe's parents.  The business began with the aim of promoting a fun and healthy lifestyle through cycling.  Our mission was to create a welcoming environment where customers are viewed as close friends.  This mission remains today with the added mission of bringing Glory to God not only through our contact with our employees and customers, but with our surrounding community.  Russell's began 44 years ago with a passion for bikes and has grown to a passion for fitness and the outdoors.  Russell's Cycling & Fitness offers our customers a full line of bicycles from Giant Bicycle, Cannondale and Electra.  Russell's also offers fitness equipment from Horizon and Matrix.  We are truly grateful and humbled to be allowed to participate with our customers in their effort to lead healthier lives by enjoying the sport of cycling.  We believe that bikes can change our world!

name: Camp Wokanda
address: 620 East Boy Scout Road Chillicothe , IL
description:
If you are looking for a great facility for your group’s next camping outing, look no further!  Acquired from W.D. Boyce Council of the Scouts BSA of America, Camp Wokanda encompasses over 300 acres of woodland area with a lake for fishing and various camping amenities.  Whether you like to rough it or camp with a little more comfort, Camp Wokanda will fit the bill!  Within the Camp there is a dining hall, sleeping cabins, program buildings, and more.  The Camp also offers programming such as naturalist tours and environmental educations for interested groups.

Wokanda is a great location for a family reunion, wedding or simply a weekend unplugged.

name: Noble Center
description:
The Noble Center is not only home to the Peoria Park District’s administration offices, but also offers opportunities for rentals such as an auditorium with a stage–ideal for weddings and special events.  It also houses the District’s Book Court  and has meeting rooms that are used for fitness classes and other District programs.

name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites, Morton
description: The Holiday Inn Express & Suites welcomes you to a one of a kind traveling experience. Conveniently located off of Interstate 74, this contemporary all-inclusive hotel is located in the heart of the Pumpkin Capital of the world. The modern rooms feature high-speed internet, a 32” flat screen TV with cable channels, spacious desk areas, high pressure showers, coffeemakers and more. Suites also include a pull out sofa bed and a kitchenette. Other hotel amenities include a complimentary Smart Start Breakfast, a relaxing indoor pool & spa, fully equipped fitness center, 24-hour business center, private Board Room and complimentary parking. The staff at the Holiday Inn Express & Suites are proud to offer superior customer service and conveniences to make your business, leisure or team travel easy and enjoyable.

name: Pekin Park District
description:
Since 1902, the Pekin Park District has proudly served the varied and ever-changing recreational needs of our community and the surrounding area.

You'll find our many neighborhood parks offer a variety of activities, while our outer parks provide endless acres and the opportunity to get in touch with nature. But, we're more than open spaces and beautifully-landscaped parks. We have activities, programs, leagues, and memberships for almost every recreational taste or family interest.

name: Loft
address: 5201 W War Memorial Dr Peoria , IL 61615
description: Loft at The Shoppes at Grand Prairie in Peoria, IL is all about style. Our women’s clothing is feminine and casual, including women’s pants, dresses, sweaters, blouses, denim, skirts, suits, accessories, petites, tall sizes and more. Find your new favorite look at Loft!

name: Mark Twain Boutique Hotel
description:
The 111 room Mark Twain Boutique Hotels is one of the premier accommodations in Downtown Peoria!

Overnight guests receive many complimentary extras including high-speed wireless internet, DVD players with surround sound, Starbucks coffee and cocoa in the lobby, local shuttle service, USA Today, Bath and Body Works products and Seattle’s Best coffee in each room.

MEETING SPACE:
350 sq. ft. of total meeting space
Next door to Packard Plaza, which has nearly 7,000 sq. ft of space

name: Lariat Steakhouse
description: The longest established privately owned restaurant in Peoria.  “Best steaks, consistently high quality and service”....Sales and Marketing Magazine.

name: Super 8 Washington
description:
Nice and clean stay at an affordable price. Offering 47 rooms, complimentary continental breakfast, fax and copy service and with a helping staff. Located nearby all major attractions around the Peoria area. Located 10 miles from Peoria and Eureka College.

Stop in and stay the night at the pet-friendly Super 8 Washington/Peoria Area hotel. Their location provides quick access to the Peoria area and popular local attractions, like Par-A-Dice Casino. Their hotel is environmentally friendly, which means they waste less water and use less electricity; make them your eco-friendly hotel choice in the Peoria area.

name: Creighton Woods Park

Neighborhood parks like Creighton Woods are a great way to spend time outside and build a healthier lifestyle.

name: Wingate by Wyndham, Peoria at Grand Prairie
description: The Wingate by Wyndham provides an enjoyable one of a kind experience for every kind of traveler. Conveniently located across from the Shoppes at Grand Prairie, the Wingate offers an all-inclusive price for each of its 65 spacious rooms. Each room features high-speed internet, a microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, flat screen HDTV and a spacious desk area. Included in our guests stay is a complimentary breakfast buffet each morning and an evening Manager’s Reception every Monday through Thursday with delicious appetizers and complimentary adult beverages. Guests also enjoy a variety of hotel amenities including a relaxing indoor pool and spa, fully equipped fitness center, complimentary shuttle service, 24-hour business center and Sundry Convenience Shop. The staff at the Wingate by Wyndham invite you to experience an all inclusive property with superior customer service.

name: Three Sisters Park
description:
Three Sisters Park is a 400-acre private park in Chillicothe, located along the Illinois River, just 17 miles North of Peoria, Illinois.

This dedicated parkland is a model farm for educational, recreational, and conservational purposes. The master plan for the park is a vision of the creation of a living history farm-- including a central building for activities, large festival areas, a welcome center, a restaurant, an agricultural equipment museum and activity area, and an outdoor natural amphitheater.

The open fields and forested areas offer one-of-a-kind spaces for special events, concerts, and festivals.The park is available for special events, weddings, corporate retreats, family reunions, and much more.

Three Sisters Park is currently the home of the Summer Camp Music Festival, held annually over Memorial Day weekend.

name: Hampton Inn & Suites - Peoria
description: We love having you here! Conveniently located by the Shoppes at Grand Prairie, the Hampton Inn & Suites offers an all-inclusive price for it spacious rooms and abundant amenities. Make yourself at home in one of our 78 rooms while you enjoy complimentary high-speed internet, multiple cable channels, a Cloud Nine Bed experience and a spacious and well lit desk area for all of your business and entertainment needs. Wake up in the morning to a complimentary On the House breakfast buffet or grab a On the Run breakfast to-go bag. Enjoy other hotel amenities including our fully equipped fitness center, relaxing indoor pool and spa, 24-hour business center, complimentary shuttle service to local attractions and more. The staff at the Hampton Inn & Suites are proud to host you as our guest and as a friend.

name: It's A Vibe Selfie Studio
address: 2200 W War Memorial Dr. Peoria , IL 61613
description:
An interactive selfie studio with over 20 installations inspired by art, music, TV, travel, celebrities, and culture designed to give you the ultimate selfie experience.

Interactive photogenic selfie studio with an installation inspired by the world.

name: Luthy Botanical Garden
description:
This beautiful spot includes 5 acres of landscaped gardens including the Woodland Garden, Children's Garden, Herb Garden, and others. The tropical conservatory is open year-round. Hours are open daily 10-5.

Luthy Botanical Garden Whether you love to garden or just appreciate the beauty of various flora from around the globe, Luthy Botanical Garden is the spot for you. Spread across over 5 acres in Glen Oak Park, Luthy is home to a tropical conservatory, a theme garden, and seasonal shows, including the Poinsettia Show throughout November and December. The sprawling garden is also a beautiful background for weddings, showers, or your next corporate event! Photographers are always welcome at the Gardens – for fees and other information contact bstreitmatter@peoriaparks.org. 

Amenities: Classes, Field Trips, Holiday Events, Memberships, Rentals, Special Events, Weddings

name: Mossville Soccer Complex
address: P.O. Box 294 PO Box 294 Mossville , IL 61552
description: Mossville Soccer Complex is a multi-purpose facility located on over 68 acres, boasting 27 fields, including an indoor field. Ample space, along with expertise and experience, this soccer complex is a facility able to take on soccer tournaments of any size with ease.

name: Super 8 Motel-Chillicothe
description:
Located in Chillicothe, Super 8 by Wyndham Chillicothe is within a 10-minute drive of Chillicothe Country Club and Daryl Danner Memorial Park. This motel is 3.2 mi (5.1 km) from Hedrick Medical Center and 3.4 mi (5.5 km) from Green Hills Golf Course.

Popular Hotel Amenities and Features
This smoke-free motel features motorized watercraft on site, sailing nearby, and water skiing nearby. Recreational activities include rafting nearby.

Business, Other Amenities
Featured amenities include a business center, express check-out, and complimentary newspapers in the lobby. Free self parking is available onsite.

Restaurants, Bars, Lounge & Dining options
A complimentary full breakfast is served daily from 6 AM to 9 AM.

Renovations
Due to COVID-19, this property’s food and beverage options may be limited.

Hotel Accommodations and Guest Rooms
Make yourself at home in one of the 55 air-conditioned rooms featuring refrigerators and microwaves. Complimentary wireless Internet access keeps you connected, and cable programming is available for your entertainment. Private bathrooms with shower/tub combinations feature complimentary toiletries and hair dryers. Conveniences include desks and coffee/tea makers, and housekeeping is provided daily.

name: Par-A-Dice Hotel Casino
description: The Par-A-Dice Hotel Features 202 luxurious rooms and suites and is the perfect retreat for a relaxing getaway or productive business meeting. Voted one of the Midwest's finest casino hotels, all rooms include upscale amenities. The hotel just steps away from the exciting casino action, with a free shuttle service available rain or shine. Toll Free: 800-547-0711

name: Grandview Drive and Park
description:
Listed on the National Register of Historic Places, Grand View Drive is a 2.52 mile meandering pleasure driveway constructed in 1903. The “world’s most beautiful drive,” as President Theodore Roosevelt referred to it in a visit to Peoria in 1910, offers visitors numerous panoramic scenic views of the Illinois River Valley and the chance to view many historic and remarkable homes lining it. The linear park is especially beautiful in autumn, with the ever-changing colors of fall leaves.  Grand View Drive has 1.75 miles of paved sidewalk for hiking.

name: Peoria Civic Center
description: Carver Arena inside the Peoria Civic Center is home to major sporting events and big name concerts, seating up to 12,000, but it is also versatile for large trade shows events. With 27,400 square feet of floor space, the arena can accommodate 140 booth spaces on the floor and an additional 70 booths around the outer concourse.

name: The Nature Conservancy
description: We're working around the world to protect the lands and waters on which all life depends and fight climate change. Join us.

name: Contemporary Art Center of Peoria
address: 305 Southwest Water Street, Peoria, IL 61602, USA
description: Peoria's cultural hub featuring art exhibitions, artist studios, art instruction, comedy improv, poetry nights, yoga and tai chi classes, jazz and blues performances. The Contemporary Art Center exhibits the work of living artists at the forefront of their fields. About 20 resident artists are constantly creating art on-site as well as prolific artist and co-founder Preston Jackson continues to maintain his sculpture and painting studio.

name: Dickson Mounds State Museum
address: 10956 N. Dickson Mounds Rd. Lewistown , IL 61542
description: This park consists of prairie and timbered area surrounding the Dickson Mounds State Museum.

name: Kelleher's Irish Pub & Eatery
description:
Kelleher’s is located on Peoria’s historic downtown riverfront and is situated in one of its oldest warehouses.
We offer traditional Irish fare as well as American Style pub food.

name: The Fish House
description: Opened in 1976, the Fish House has been serving the greater Peoria Area the freshest in seafood for over 44 years.

name: Peoria Historical Society
description: The roots of the Peoria Historical Society can be traced as far back as 1839. Incorporated in 1934 as the Peoria Historical Society, the Society was established to enhance the quality of life in the Peoria area by: collecting, preserving and displaying items relating to our history; encouraging and supporting historical research and education; and promoting and sustaining public interest in the history and contributions of our people and organizations.Our MissionTo preserve, share and celebrate the stories of the Peoria area.Our commitmentTo support historical scholarship and collaborate with other preservation organizations, museums, and corporations.Our visionTo be the community resource and advocate for historical preservation and research on the Peoria area, its organizations and its people.

name: Hacienda El Mirador
address: 5805 N. Humboldt Ave. Suite 1 Peoria , IL 61614
description:
For Julia Roca creating a friendly, welcoming atmosphere at Hacienda El Mirador in Junction City shopping center allows those stopping in to eat to be more like friends than customers.

“There are no strangers here,” said Roca,” Peoria is a big family and I am happy to be part of it.”
 
With a menu to satisfy any taste and seasonal dishes, it is no surprise that her “friends” keep coming back. Hacienda El Mirador focuses on well-prepared meals with great presentation and flavor. 
 
Fresh margarita samplers are the best way to get a taste of all the unique flavors Julia has to offer at the bar, some with a kick and others as smooth as can be.

name: Nelson's Deli, Par-A-Dice
description: Featuring a variety of deli sandwiches, hamburgers, fresh wraps and salads, Nelson's is the perfect spot to grab a quick bite. You can also grab ice cream or a cup of coffee for dessert.

name: Peoria Ballet Company
description: The Peoria Ballet offers a season of spectacular dance performances featuring the Peoria Ballet Company and guest artists from across the globe, while the Peoria Ballet Academy provides excellent dance education in ballet, modern, jazz, tap and hip hop. Visit us on our website at www.peoriaballet.com

name: Detweiller Park
description:
Detweiller is a popular multi-use destination for Peoria area residents who enjoy running/walking, soccer, volleyball, hiking, birding, and many other outdoor activities. Detweiller Drive, which runs through much of the park, features one of the finest, most diverse collections of oaks around. The early spring show of blooming redbuds, as well as the colorful fall foliage should not be missed!

Nature lovers will love exploring one or more of the park’s 5+ miles of hiking trails traversing the Illinois River bluffs.  If you have questions about rentals at this park, please call 309-682-1200.

address: 2601 N. Main St. East Peoria , IL 61611
description:
Jonah's Seafood House, 2601 Oyster Bar, and Market & Bake Shop are all open! View our new hours, menus, and stop in today to see our newly updated dining room. Jonah’s continues the tradition of serving fresh seafood, flown in daily.

A boutique market and bakery featuring fresh seafood, choice meats, exotic cheeses, fresh brewed coffee, imported and domestic wines, craft beers.

name: Waters Edge Winery & Bistro - Peoria Heights
address: 4450 N Prospect Rd Suite S-12, Peoria Heights, IL
description: Waters Edge Winery & Bistro - Peoria Heights is a craft winery in the heart of Central Illinois making eco friendly, low sulfite, international wines – Locally! Our tasting room is open six days a week to provide a warm, friendly environment. We offer wine tastings, flights, a large selection of varietals, charcuterie, gift items, and personalized bottles of wine. Join our wine club and reap the benefits of being a member. Our love for wine and creating a space for our friends and neighbors to congregate is why we are here! Come check us out!

name: Nelson's Catering
description: Welcome to Nelsons Catering Springfield & Central Illinois Since 1995 Nelson’s: More than a chef… an Attentive, Experienced TEAM you can Trust! We have twenty years of experience in full service catering, let us put our skill and talent to work for you. Our #1 goal is to provide a catering service above & beyond the standard outfit. We realize the pressure you’re under to plan a successful event.

name: That Guy's Secret
address: 2200 W War Memorial Dr Peoria , IL 61613
description: That Guy's Secret is a premier men's boutique utilizing customized fashion. From tuxedo rentals to golf attire, you're sure to find something at That Guy's Secret!

name: Boyd's Steakhouse, Par-A-Dice
description: Enjoy an elegant dinner in our exclusive steakhouse featuring only the finest prime meats and fish. Exclusive wine list. Reservations requested. Open 7 days for dinner 4:00 - 9:00 p.m., 10:00 p.m. Friday and Saturday.

name: Steak & Fries
address: 1200 W Main St. Suite 26 Peoria , IL 61606
description: Steak & Fries is a locally owned sandwich shop located in Campustown in Peoria, IL. They sell a variety of tasty and unique sandwiches such as the Philly Turkey, Butterfly Pork Chop, and Steak Supreme. They also have kids meals, a variety of sides, and of course, delicious fresh fries!

name: Lillie M. Evans Library District
description: The Lillie M. Evans Library is a place for everyone. The library has public access computers available; provides free Wi-Fi for mobile devices; hosts story times, school visits, and a variety of children’s programs; consistently provides adult programs, activities and computer classes; and is a great place to learn, read and study. The facility is ADA compliant and houses our collection which includes approximately 30,000 items. The library's homepage (lmelibrary.org) is a virtual library available 24/7 and includes a variety of online resources such as ebooks and eaudiobooks. The library is a member of the Resource Sharing Alliance which makes it easy for our users to search and to borrow materials from almost 200 libraries in central Illinois. We are also a member of Bike the Trail Library to Library (ritlibraries.org) and our bike repair station is conveniently located on the Rock Island Trail route that passes through Princeville.

name: WMBD TV
description: WMBD-TV is a CBS–affiliated television station licensed to Peoria, Illinois, United States and serving the North-Central Illinois television market. It broadcasts a high definitiondigital signal on UHF channel 30 (or virtual channel 31 via PSIP) from a transmitter on Pinecrest Drive in East Peoria, a section of Groveland Township, Tazewell County. The station is owned by the Nexstar Media Group, which also operates Bloomington-licensed Fox affiliate WYZZ-TV (channel 43) under a local marketing agreement (LMA) with owner Cunningham Broadcasting. The two stations share studio facilities on North University Street in Peoria.

name: Kep's Sports Bar & Grill
description: Kep's Sports Bar and Grill is a full service restaurant with big-screen TVs, six video gambling machines, kids arcade games, and a full service bar, complete with wine, spirits, and fourteen beers on tap. Stop by as soon as you can, check out their daily specials, exciting and inviting atmosphere, and of course cheer on your favorite team while you’re there!

name: Village of Princeville
description: Located in Northwest Peoria County, located 15 miles from Peoria. Princeville is "small in size, big in opportunities" and is home to Princeville High School, Princeville Grade School and numerous businesses. History, hiking and camping are popular at nearby Jubilee State Park. Come visit the Princeville Heritage Museum and the Rock Island Trail located within the Village of Princeville.

name: The Missing Zither
description:
The Missing Zither is a Libations Lounge serving coffee-infused craft cocktails, along with traditional cocktail drinks, spirits, wine by the glass, and more. Brought to you by the owners of [CxT] Roasting Company. Enjoy the versatility of coffee in a natural extension to alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages.

address: 4601 N Prospect Rd, Peoria Heights, IL 61616
description: Peoria Heights // The Nook is your one stop shop for great gifts, beautiful decor, fun accessories, & on-trend apparel! Whether you are looking for that perfect gift or something unique for you or your home; you are sure to fall in love with something from The Nook! We look forward to helping you find that perfect item for all occasions!

name: Peoria German American Society
description: The German-American Central Society was formed in the late 1920’s. German American clubs of one form or another have been in the Peoria area for over 150 years. The purpose and objectives of the corporation shall be to promote German culture in the Peoria, Illinois area, including singing, sports, and good fellowship. Members of good character, especially those of German background and/or ancestry, are encouraged to become involved.The GACS owns two properties. The Lindenhof, 7601 N Harker Avenue and home of the GACS, is open each Friday night to the general public for German style buffets. The Lindenhof features a full bar and kitchen. The Lindenhof also hosts other German related events such as our very popular Kristkindlmarkt. Hickory Grove Park, just north of Peoria, off of Route 40 in Dunlap, is setup much like a traditional German biergarten. The GACS host six major public events each summer at this property.Both facilities are available for rentals. Please contact the Lindenhof at (309)691-7484 to make inquiries or e-mail info@peoriagermans.net.

name: Eastlight Theatre
description: A nonprofit regional community theater only five minutes from the Par-A-Dice Riverboat Casino. The air conditioned theater seats over 1,000 and features the best Midwest and Chicago professional entertainers.

name: Sweet Basil Cafe of Peoria
description: If you need great food at great prices for your next event, you came to the right place! Sweet Basil Cafe is family owned and operated. Our food is prepared with only the finest and freshest ingredients. Our staff is happy to provide you with outstanding service that will make your special event a truly memorable one.

name: Kuchie's On The Water
description: Kuchie's on the Water is a casual riverfront restaurant in Creve Coeur! Home of the ORIGINAL SHIPWRECK BLOODY MARY(Sundays only). Offering sandwiches and burgers, a huge appetizer menu and seafood, we serve lunch and dinner daily (except Mondays during the off season) ...Offering a full service bar, good food, a unique menu,and a great river side setting. Our huge deck is open for dining during the summer. Docking available for up to 15 boats while dining, Casual attire, relaxed atmosphere. Team Trivia on Wednesday nights. 10 minutes from downtown Peoria. 10 minutes from Par-a-Dice Casino in East Peoria. 10 minutes from the airport.

name: Pizza Ranch Peoria
description:
Peoria Pizza Ranch is a western themed buffet that is very family friendly. 
 You will discover a full soup and salad buffet, pizza buffet and chicken buffet with all the fixins'. One bite, and you'll know why we claim to have the "Country's Best Chicken"!
 Don't see your favorite pizza on the buffet? Just request it, and when it comes out from the oven, you'll get the first two slices! That way everyone gets what they are craving! 
 Finish your meal with a slice of our famous streusel dessert by itself, or with your choice of fruit baked right in; with a side of creamy ice cream. 
 Bring the herd into Pizza Ranch for "crave-able" flavors and a legendary experience!

Each guest room at our hotel in Morton, Illinois, features free Wi-Fi Internet, 32-inch flat-screen TV, microwave and refrigerator. Start fresh every day with free continental breakfast. Our on-site gym and heated indoor pool help keep you stay fit while away from home.

description: What started 55 years ago as an open-air skating rink is now the perfect place for a night of family fun. With fun, family friendly music and a homey atmosphere, kids young and old will have a great time skating the night away. Come and enjoy the fun!

description: Offers a variety of speakers specializing in a diverse field of topics for nonprofit organizations. Campus tours available. Professional Development Institute offers seminars and workshops in the areas of computers, health, management and special interests (can be customized).

name: Washington Park Pool
description: Whether you are looking to relax in the sun or cool off in the water, the Washington Park Pool is a perfect summer hangout. This park features three pools including a zero-depth interactive play area, a competition pool with several lanes and two diving boards, and a wading pool with a slide. With a playground, plenty of lounge chairs and shade umbrellas, the Washington Park Pool is a favorite summer hangout.

name: Peoria Riverfront Museum
address: 222 SW Washington St, Peoria, IL 61602, USA
description: The only multidisciplinary museum of its kind in the nation, the Peoria Riverfront Museum uses art, science, history and achievement to inspire confidence, lifelong learning, and talent. Since opening in 2012, the privately funded museum has provided more than one million experiences through major exhibitions, a permanent collection, interactive galleries, a dome planetarium, giant screen theater and educational programming including curricula-related student visits. The AAM-accredited, Smithsonian-affiliated private nonprofit museum is supported by more than 4,000 members and donors, and is housed in a county-owned LEED Gold-certified building on a campus overlooking the Illinois River. The museum has been designated one of the 200 great places in Illinois by the American Institute of Architects.

name: Childers Eatery - Camp (East Peoria)
address: 815 W Camp St, East Peoria, IL 61611
description:
If you’re from Central Illinois, it’s hard to remember a time when Childers Eatery wasn’t feeding the hearts, souls and stomachs of Peoria-area diners. Serving for over 45 years, join us any day of the week at one of our establishments.

We’ve always offered great food and service at affordable prices, so what’s new? Well, for starters, we grow organic fruits and vegetables on-site, at our University location, for the ultimate in wholesome freshness. We are constantly revising our menu to offer tried-and-true classics, new twists on old breakfast and lunch favorites and trendy creative new dishes. From the classics to new trends, we offer everything you love – and the new dishes you’ll start to crave.

name: Tawny Oaks Field Station
address: 715 West Singing Woods Road Edelstein , IL
description:
The Tawny Oaks Field Station is the newest environmental facility in the Peoria Park District!  Tawny Oaks is comprised of a prairie restoration, ½ mile of handicap accessible gravel trail, a picnic area, and visitor center with restrooms.  Tawny Oaks is open seasonally and offers various workshops, educational walks, and bird watching events.

name: Peoria Art Guild
description:
For over 142 years, the Peoria Art Guild has been dedicated to “bringing art to the community and the community to art”. As a visual arts leader, we take pride in our organization's efforts to educate young artists through classes, showcase art diversity, exhibit multidisciplinary art and promote art throughout our community.

In 2021, we will celebrate our 59th Anniversary of hosting the Peoria Fine Art Fair. The Peoria Fine Art Fair is one of the largest visual arts events in Central Illinois. Our juried Art Fair features 130 local, national and international artists from all across the United States and numerous countries around the world and was ranked #20 in the nation in 2020.

he Peoria Art Guild also hosts Sculpture Walk Peoria which places 8 sculptures on Washington St every two years. Find out more at https://www.peoriaartguild.org/

name: Walz Label & Mailing Systems
address: 624 High Point Lane East Peoria , IL  61611
description: Local, family owned company since 1966. Well known for its broad line of mailing & shipping systems and mail support equipment such as folders/inserters, mail sorting and tracking systems, and mail center management tools.

name: Bearded Owl Brewing
description:
Gather around the campfire, the origin story of Bearded Owl Brewery is best told illuminated by a crackling flame in the woods. While taking an evening hike with his son Jimmy on a camping trip, Nick Babock's attempts at giving young Jimmy a scare came back to bite him, or better yet, scratch him. Upon entering an old, abandoned barn, Nick discovered he was not alone inside he saw the orange eyes of a horned own roosting. Jimmy, reluctantly following his dad inside, was stunned by the giant bird. As the owl took flight, both Nick and Kimmy hit the ground to avoid its large talons. 

Quickly becoming a Central Illinois favorite, Bearded Owl is a great place to grab a local brew any day of the week. The Discover Peoria team recommends the Will-O'-the-Whisp, Farmhouse ale with basil.

name: The Spot Coffee
address: 9901 N Knoxville Ave St. A Peoria , IL 61615
description:
The Spot Coffee proudly features extraordinary small batch artisan coffees and gourmet teas, an evolving menu of seasonal drinks and the highest quality of locally crafted baked goods. 

From the time we steep the organic rosebuds and lavender into our famous handcrafted syrups to the moment the foam from your favorite latte hits your lips, we promise to always offer the finest in quality and flavor.

name: The Cigar Shack Mobile Cigar Lounge
description:
The Cigar Shack Mobile Cigar Lounge is the original central Illinois mobile cigar lounge built to create a one-of-a-kind experience that your guests will never forget.

This vintage 1976 Airstream Sovereign International Land Yacht 31’, with its custom interior and outdoor seating options, will elevate your event and impress your friends.

Inside is a premium cigar smoker’s paradise featuring everything you need for an afternoon or evening filled with great memories for you and your guests.

Why not take your social event to the next level with this very unique experience.

We are based in central Illinois but the beauty of being mobile means we can come to you wherever you are. Climate controlled. Equipped with smoke evacuation systems and fully self-contained.

Available for: Weddings, Private/Corporate & Special Events, Golf Outings, Poker Night, Tailgating, etc.

description: Radish Kitchen is a dedicated vegan facility. All products created and sold in this store are made from whole foods sourced from local organic farms. Our mission is to make plant-based and vegan eating more available and accessible to the region. We approach every avenue with kindness at the forefront as our goal is to always do the least amount of harm. This is why collaboration, education, community building, and compassion for the Earth, for all beings, and for each other are our core values.

name: Columbia Park
description:
Check out a book at the McClure Branch Library and then spend some time in the sun. Featuring picnic tables, play equipment and a walking trail that feature a Story Walk, Columbia Park is a great family place to relax!  The Story Walk book changes every two weeks, so please visit often!

name: Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory
address: 4700 N. University Street Suite #21 Peoria , IL 61614
description: One visit to our store and you'll discover why Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory is the number one destination of chocolate lovers everywhere. Throughout our store you will discover a fantastic variety of delicious chocolates and confections to satisfy cravings of even the most ardent chocoholic! Watch as we dip crisp apples in thick, bubbling caramel from a traditional copper kettle. Smile as we roll them in a rainbow of tasty toppings to complete your old fashioned treat. Linger awhile longer and learn how fudge is made as we fashion a creamy loaf on a traditional marble slab, the old fashioned way, right before your eyes. But don't leave without sharing your experience with a gift of fine chocolate, elegantly crafted and beautifully packaged in boxes, tins and baskets. Let us share the Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory in-store experience with you, as we invite you to explore our site for ordering information, special offers, and events. Enjoy the convenience of delivery or choose to pick up your order. We look forward to serving you!

name: Giant Oak Park
description:
At one acre, Giant Oak Park is one of the District’s smallest parks, with a single tree and a giant name. It contains a small parking and picnic area, and is home to a large burr oak tree, believed to be at least 300 years old. Its branches span at least 100 feet and the trunk is 13 feet in circumference. This park features the Historic Easton Fountain as a part of its landscape.

name: Tequila's Mexican Bar & Grill
address: 370 West Washington St East Peoria , IL 61611
description:
Hector Munoz and his family migrated from Guadalajara, Mexico to East Peoria when he was 15 years old. He has fond memories of growing up in East Peoria and always enjoyed being an active member of the community. 

Coming from a family of great cooks, Hector always enjoyed cooking and creating exciting dishes of his own. Tequila’s Mexican Bar & Grill, located in the Levee District, is one of Hector’s greatest accomplishments. He enjoys serving the community and seeing customers return.

Hector is excited for the growth he has seen in the community and looks for ways to keep contributing.

description:
Now open at 3:30pm 5 days a week (closed Mondays & Tuesdays), Oliver's Main Street Pub began as our third Oliver's location, but it is the first of its kind in Toluca. Oliver's Main Street Pub serves Oliver's famous pizza, handmade burgers, Three-Step Wings, and an array of freshly-prepared fried appetizers like our PBR Beer-Battered Onion Rings. Oliver's Main Street Pub features a variety of craft beer selections, including Weihenstephan Hefeweizen, as well as several rotating craft selections.

Our Toluca location is cozy, authentic, friendly, and hip--but relaxing.

name: Coyote Creek Golf Club
description: Stunning 18 hole Public Championship Golf Course with spacious practice facilities and driving range. The course at Coyote Creek spans 6,700 yards of picturesque Illinois landscape with 10 acres of lakes, bent grass fairways and beautiful elevation change. Our clubhouse offer the Coyote Creek Pub and Eatery for a meal after your round or anytime. Our banquet rooms can accommodate up to 300 quest for weddings, parties or our special brunches. Our kitchen also offers catering for offsite events.

name: Springdale Cemetery Savanna
description: Springdale Cemetery, founded in 1857, was part of the Rural Cemetery Movement that took cemeteries out of the control of the church and created non-denominational, architecturally designed burial places that were also attractive parks with ponds, forests, roads and paths that followed the natural contours of the land and nurtured native and exotic trees and plants. Before the widespread development of public parks, these cemeteries provided a place for all the people to enjoy refined outdoor recreation amidst art and sculpture previously available only for the wealthy

Tin Lizard Bar & Grill is your go-to spot for a lively yet comfortable atmosphere! Catch up with your friends for dinner, meet up with coworkers, or go on a date night all while enjoying good drinks and great food, and listening to the best local & regional bands.

description: With all the charm and convenience of a small river town, Chillicothe has easy access to shopping, dining, and entertainment. Its downtown business district is classic Main Street USA. Famous for its music festival, cheesecake, train tracks, picturesque downtown, and small-town charm.

name: Jubilee College State Park
description: Jubilee College State Park is a 3,200 acre facility, located in Peoria County between the towns of Kickapoo and Brimfield.  This scenic area, with its rolling topography and meandering Jubilee Creek, offers numerous outdoor recreational activities.

name: Peoria Journal Star
description:
Peoria’s largest newspaper offers hour-long group tours of their printing facility. The tour includes mechanical, business and editorial aspects of the newspaper and gives a basic overview of publishing a newspaper from news gathering to finished product. Free. Two week notice please.  Children must be at least 10 years old to tour the facility. 
Call 309-686-3020.

name: Village of Peoria Heights
description:
Peoria Heights is famous for Tower Park which hosts its one-of-a-kind 200 ft. Observation Tower that provides gorgeous panoramic views of the Village, the Illinois River Valley, and it's surrounding areas.

Being home to Forest Park Nature Center, the Rock Island Greenway, and Grandview Drive, makes Peoria Heights perfect for any active lifestyle.

Teddy Roosevelt named Grandview Drive the “World’s Most Beautiful Drive” in 1910 for a reason, as it has the most breathtaking views of the river and many historic and remarkable estates lining it.

name: Pottstown Meat & Deli
address: 4630 N University Street Suites 51/52 Peoria , IL 61614
description: Pottstown Meat & Deli is a retail meat market, focusing on the highest quality of beef, pork, lamb and poultry - with a good amount being sourced from local farms. They also specialize in a vast variety of smoked products, including their own Snack Sticks, Jerky, Bacon, Hams, and Salami.  They also make over 40 flavors of marinated Chicken Breasts.

name: Country Club of Peoria
description: Established in 1897 “to encourage athletic exercises, recreation and social enjoyment.” The Country Club of Peoria strives to go beyond our original mission every day by dedicating ourselves to providing superior, family-focused and business-friendly environments for social, dining and athletic activities through unparalleled service, staff and facilities. What began as a club with a nine-hole golf course at the edge of the city is now a spacious campus offering conveniently located 18-hole golf, cuisine, tennis, swimming, fitness, social events and other amenities. Nestled among the lush greenery and majestic architecture of Grandview Drive, the Country Club of Peoria provides a traditional, private club experience surrounded by unrivaled natural beauty and a sense of history.

name: Realty Executives Acclaimed
address: 4450 N Prospect Rd Peoria Heights , IL 61616
description: Realty Executives Acclaimed serves the tri-county area, Peoria, Tazewell and Woodford counties for all your residential & commercial property needs.

name: The Ronald Reagan Museum at Eureka College
description: Housed in the Donald B. Cerf Center, the Reagan Museum at Eureka College features a collection of over 2,000 items from President Reagan’s student days at Eureka, his movie and television career, his eight years as Governor of California, his campaign for presidency, and his two terms in office. At the request of Mr. Reagan, the first items in the collection came to the College in 1975. It is now the largest collection of Reagan memorabilia outside of the Reagan library in California.

description: Trefzger's is a full-line bakery offering a variety of breakfast pastries and cookies and specializing in cakes for all occasions from luncheons to weddings.

name: Robinson Park
description:
Narrow, informal paths lace the site, along with a substantial segment of the better-developed Illinois River Bluff Trail. For the ecologically-oriented visitor, the most intriguing component of Robinson Park is its 151-acre nature preserve, which consists of glacial drift hill prairies, and oak woodlands along the ridges and valleys.  If you have questions about rentals at this park, please call 309-682-1200.

name: Cyd's in the Park
description:
Cyd’s in the Park gives the Peoria area a unique + delicious food experience. This modern day, multi-option gourmet storefront meets full service restaurant + bar, caters to the Central Illinois community who care about fast, fresh food.

Now located in Donovan Park, Cyd’s Star Bar + Grill proudly creates your dream made-to-order grilled sandwiches + burgers, fresh + healthy salads, house-made soups + cafe plates for an extra special touch. Join us for lunch, dinner, and dessert in our unique restaurant, or on the patio for al fresca dining in Donovan Park.  Our Star Bar is a lovely way to spend some time with a delicious beer, crafted cocktail, and some bar snacks.  The Beer Garden invites you to settle in under the pine trees in the park.  It’s a place meant for relaxing gatherings and casual fun, perfect for savoring a cold one after enjoying the many activities at Donovan Park.

Cyd’s Market offers fresh food that fits your lifestyle: casual dining on our lower patio, a perfectly packed picnic in Donovan Park, or food to Take Away.   From our daily-crafted salads to our wide selection of entrees, side dishes, appetizers and more, we offer what Central illinois is hungry for. Whether it’s tonight’s meal or catering trays for a gathering- Cyd’s has what you are craving.

With a fanatical focus on pastries + sweets, Cyd’s Bakery serves dessert all day. From our decadent decorated layer cakes, cupcakes, creative cookies, and crazy-rich brownies, we hope that you’ll save room for something sweet.

The Cyd’s Coffee + Juice Bar proudly brews Illinois own Steam Shovel Coffee, freshly roasted in Cobden, IL. The Juice Bar serves made to order fresh fruit + vegetable blends, as well as 100% real fruit smoothies. Dedicated to an amazing food + drink experience, we hope you will come and spend some time with us.

name: Caterpillar Visitors Center
description:
The Caterpillar Visitors Center is a fascinating look at the company, the iron and the people making sustainable progress possible around the world. From the humble beginnings of the first tractor to the company's present-day leadership in building infrastructure and powering the planet—it's all right here on Peoria's beautiful riverfront. 

You'll find interactive displays and exhibits sure to engage and entertain visitors of all ages. Spend an hour or an afternoon. It's all up to you. 

Reflect on the past and enjoy a journey through time in the Caterpillar Heritage Gallery. From helping build San Francisco's famed cable car system to the construction of the Three Gorges Dam in China, to the widening of the Panama Canal and hundreds of important milestones in between, Caterpillar was there and you can learn about it all here. 

Explore how customers' ideas drive design and product decisions in the Immersive Visualization center where you can sit in the seat of a machine of the future or walk an assembly line of a factory not yet built. It's the same 3D technology that Caterpillar uses to design and build machines, engines and factories today, and it's a fascinating look into product development. 

Open your imagination in a visit to the Future Theater where the possibilities of tomorrow's world unfold, seeming as vast as the planet itself. Meet the people Caterpillar people—employees, suppliers, dealers and customers—make sustainable progress possible around the world every day. Visit Caterpillar people at work and see them through windows of different parts of the world. Learn how Caterpillar people all over the globe help neighbors and give back to their communities. 

Take home a tractor Or a Cat hat! The on-site Cat Merchandise Center offers a wide selection of collector die-cast scale models and the latest in Cat and Caterpillar branded footwear and designer apparel. Find the perfect gift for the Cat enthusiast in your family. Or pick out a pair of popular Cat boots for yourself. 

The corporate meeting rooms at the Caterpillar Visitors Center are available for half-day and full-day rentals, as well as evening events. All rooms include VGA, HDMI and audio receptacles for laptop connectivity. Each room has its own video projector and projection screen and is wired with microphones and speakers for clear audio and teleconferencing. Rooms are designed to host corporate meetings and events. Room rental rates also include complimentary access to the exhibit areas on the meeting day(s). 

MEETING SPACE: 4,376 sq. ft. of total meeting space Number of meeting rooms: 3 Largest meeting room: 2,576 sq. ft. Banquet capacity: 104 Outdoor balcony space with views of the Illinois River.

name: Best Western Plus-East Peoria
address: 300 East Light Ct. East Peoria , IL  61611
description:
When staying at an East Peoria hotel, guests deserve convenience. For those traveling for business with Caterpillar, headquarters is only a few miles away. Bradley University is also in the area, and this hotel
caters to students, staff, professors and their loved ones, whether it's for a
special weekend event like graduation or lodging for an entire semester. At the Peoria Civic Center, there's always something exciting happening from tradeshows to concerts. An indoor greenhouse pool is perfect for
relaxing, but being located next to downtown Peoria and the Levee District
makes exploring a must. Start the day with a free, full hot American breakfast
and a dip in the pool to be refreshed and energized for a full itinerary. From the Peoria Riverfront Museum to Dozer Park, there's no end to the discoveries near this East Peoria hotel. Business travelers with IBM,
Komatsu, Caterpillar and ADM rely on this property because of the peace and
quiet, large rooms and accessibility to all the major corporations and business
parks. Easily accessible to the Peoria area, we're the newest hotel in Peoria
and the closest hotel to the East Side Centre. Knowledgeable staff members are always on hand to provide recommendations for sightseeing, dining and shopping. Enjoy a peaceful getaway
or stress-free business trip when staying at the right East Peoria hotel.

address: 4700 N University St Suite 13 Peoria , IL 61614
description: Unique Gizmos, in Peoria, IL, is the premier antique shop serving Peoria, Knox, and Tazewell counties since 2018. We carry furniture, bedding, candles, braided rugs, pottery, florals, dolls, gnomes, and much more. For your next shopping trip, visit Unique Gizmos in Peoria.

name: Panaderia Ortiz Bakery
description:
Benardo and Maria Ortiz moved to Peoria from Chicago in 2012 as they were searching for a new home to raise their three children in an environment that focused on family-friendly activities and neighborhoods.

What they found in Peoria was a tranquil friendliness that helped them fall in love with the city and its people.

Soon after their move, they opened the doors to Panaderia Ortiz offering the tastiest Mexican pastries in the area. As the shop became more and more popular, their menu expanded to include full lunch menus and special event catering.

Benardo and Maria are always working on new recipes and ways to provide a better experience for their customers, leaving no two visits the same. Check them out throughout the year for a variety of sweets and treats.

name: ARDOR Breads and Provisions
description:
Ardor Breads and Provisions is the culmination of Founder + Head Baker Cody Scogin obsessing with fermentation, vegetation and old-fashioned cooking techniques. 

Taking years spent in very technique-driven kitchens and translating those philosophies into an approachable "neighborhood cafe" setting, Cody founded Ardor Breads and Provisions to promote and influence the idea of ingredient-driven craft cooking over fuss and intimidation.

Ardor Breads and Provisions was developed in Scogin's home kitchen, through the Illinois Cottage Foods Act, and is now housed less than 100 yards from the farmers market where the brand was built, at 301 SW Water St, on Peoria's historic riverfront.

name: Obed & Isaac's Microbrewery and Eatery
description: Everyone at Obed Isaac's believes in Eating Well and Drinking Better Beer. They are proud to offer both in a historic, family-friendly setting inside a restored 1889 church. Enjoy handmade craft beers and ciders produced right here in Peoria, and enjoy upscale pub fare with a twist to complement your palate. Open Wednedsay - Sunday at 11am, they offer happy hour from 3-6pm. Don't miss Sunday Brunch from 11-2 every Sunday. The Beer Garden is located next to the onsite brewery. It is open Wednesday - Sunday (weather permitting). The bocce beer garden is pet and child friendly (they even make their own doggie treats for your pooch).

Our membership base of businesses, organizations and individuals work collectively to support the Pekin area businesses and community. We provide opportunities for promotion, connection and service to others, with a focus on making the Pekin area a wonderful place to live, work and play. In addition to business networking and promotion, we offer the Community Leadership Academy and we host the area’s largest community events including the Honor America Celebration and the Pekin Marigold Festival.

name: Seasons Gastropub
description:
At Seasons you will be welcomed by talented, friendly, knowledgeable and well trained staff. Guests who dine at Seasons Gastropub will be blown away by the great food at affordable prices. The food is great American Gastropub fare done fresh, utilizing great local seasonal ingredients. 

You can enjoy a quick lunch, bring the family in for dinner or enjoy a great bar selection of wines, craft beers, and cocktails while enjoying some live music and snacks. 

With open-air garage doors to welcome the sweet summer breeze and fireplaces to keep out the winter chill, Seasons Gastropub has all of the seasons covered.

name: Miranda's Bella Boutique
description:
Maria del Rosario Miranda was born and raised in Chicago but has called Peoria home since 2004. She loves the calm and charming atmosphere the city has to offer. Those reasons made it very easy for her and her husband, Luis, to choose Peoria as the place where their children would be raised and where they would start their business. 
 
Miranda’s Bella Boutique is the second business the couple owns in Peoria. The inspiration for the boutique came from her love for Mexican culture and her passion for keeping traditions alive. One of those traditions came 12 years ago when Maria and Luis were chosen to be godparents at a “Bautismo” or baptism. This is one of the seven religious sacraments of the Catholic church where an infant is initiated into the spiritual community of the church. This meant the couple would have to provide the special attire the infant would wear during mass. 
 
With no local choices in town, Maria had to take the drive to Chicago. Maria saw this opportunity and realized that the Hispanic community was missing a store in Peoria that supplied necessities for traditional celebrations. 
 
The doors to Miranda's Boutique opened in August 2021. The richness of Mexican culture is seen throughout the boutique. Timeless traditions of Mexican-Artisan-made pottery can be found all around the store. Maria hopes to help younger generations keep traditions alive by providing them with access to everything they need for special occasions celebrated in the Hispanic community. 
 
 
She’s also thrilled to provide Peoria the opportunity to empower Mexican artisans to continue their craft for generations to come by purchasing their art in her boutique.

name: Blue Margaritas Bar & Grill- Peoria
description:
Esteban Pascual is living the American dream in Peoria. He fell in love with Peoria at first sight and moved here in 2008 years from Oaxaca, Mexico. The rich culture in Peoria instantly attracted him and he knew he wanted to be part of the community. 

He started working at local restaurants and there he met Ricardo Martinez, who later would be his business partner. The two had a dream of one day owning their own restaurant. Their hard work paid off and years later they were in a partnership for their first restaurant, Blue Margaritas. Blue Margaritas was  
successful and allowed the partners to open other locations in and around
the greater Peoria area. 

Esteban continued his restaurant expansion by opening Molcajete Mexican Restaurant in Chillicothe. He  encourages others to give Peoria a chance and take part in the growth of the city.

name: Metro Centre
description:
Located in the center of Peoria, Metro Centre is Peoria's premier shopping destination, where the possibilities are endless - whether you are looking for fashions, footwear, crafts, unique gifts, dance wear or art work.  Or maybe you just want to pamper yourself with a manicure or a new hair style.  If it's dining, we feature mochas to pizzas, to ethnic cuisine.  It's all here at Metro Centre -where you are never far from your car.

name: Peddler's Way Quilt Company
description:
Peddler’s Way Quilt Co. is eclectic and fun and this makes us unique. With three owners who have different tastes and styles, our shop is like three quilt stores in one location! Our niche is bigger than just one style of fabric or one type of quilting. As you can see from our photographs, we have fabrics and samples from every genre, including Civil War reproductions, modern graphic designs, plus traditional and edgy prints. No matter what inspiration you’re looking for, you will find it at Peddler’s Way! 

Our shop’s character is reflected in the atmosphere that we nurture. We want our customers to have fun, so we make sure that we, ourselves, are having fun. We encourage laughter as an integral part of the Peddler’s Way experience. That makes everyone who comes through the door to feel comfortable. At Peddler's Way, we're all about creating a "feel good" experience.

We purchased a quilt shop because the timing was right, but more importantly, because quilting is our passion and our therapy. Our nests were emptying and it was our time to embrace something, other than laundry and helping with homework! Our lives have been enriched by quilting and we wanted to share all that we have learned, and continue to learn, with others.

Our shop is located just off the historic Washington Square, in Washington, Illinois. Washington is located just across the Illinois River from Peoria, Illinois. Stately historic buildings, housing specialty shops such as jewelry stores, kitchen stores, and antique shops, along with restaurants and museums, make The Square a quaint, one-of-a-kind place to visit. 

Peddler's Way is about 6000 square feet, with two stories of fabric as well as a classroom on the main level and another one in our basement. The deck on the front of the store runs the entire length of the building and welcomes non-quilting companions to sit outside and enjoy the weather while their other halves browse and make their purchases.

Our shop offers more variety in fabric and samples than you could ever hope to see in one location. We don’t just do a lot of things; we do a lot of things well. We are proud of our diverse selection of quilting and sewing supplies and we feel that a variety of choices is one of our strengths. This is just one of the advantages to having more than one owner/buyer/sample maker. No matter how large your group of quilters or how varied their interests, they will all enjoy a visit to Peddler’s Way Quilt Co. in Washington, Illinois!

Our store hours are Monday-Friday 10am-4pm and Saturday 10am-3pm.  Online store is 24/7.

name: Sankoty Lakes
address: 1583 Spring Bay Rd Spring Bay , IL 61611
description:
Nestled on the banks of the Illinois River at the edge of the Sankoty Aquifer, Sankoty Lakes is a stunning wilderness resort and retreat in Spring Bay, Illinois. Its lakes are home to some of the cleanest, clearest water on Earth.

This level of water quality presents a unique opportunity to raise over 20 species of fish in our state-of-the-art fish hatchery and our mile-long trout stream. Additionally, Sankoty’s unique location along the river and controlled-cell wetlands attracts thousands of migratory waterfowl every year.

Sankoty Lakes offers some of the most amazing fishing, birdwatching, photography and outdoor adventure experiences in the world.

address: 222 E Santa Fe Ave Toluca , IL 61369
description:
Trusted since 1930, the Alleman family has been bringing quick family-style home-cooked meals to Toluca and the surrounding communities.

We are more than just a convenience store. Our selection of wine, cheese, snacks, meats and treats are guaranteed to fill any craving.

The Supreme House of Cheese has all of your favorite snacks from Red Vines to chocolate pretzels and we carry over fifty varieties of gourmet candies. Our world famous Hol'n One cake donuts are baked fresh daily and are the perfect on the go treat.

name: Boating on the Lagoon
description:
A true trademark of Mineral Springs Park, the paddle boats at Boating on the Lagoon have been enjoyed by generations of families in Pekin and the surrounding areas.

Located right by the Pavilion, kids can often be seen eagerly asking their parents for a couple of dollars to run down the dock toward the colorful fleet of paddle boats and the infamous green Dragon.

The real fun begins while cruising out onto the water. Not only will you see fish chasing the wake of your travels, but you can also get a closer look at the many ducks and geese that call the Lagoon home each Summer.

Two large water fountains also spray high in the air, providing a cooling mist while your legs get a great workout. Be warned: if you let the boat captain steer you too close to the spray, you’ll end up a little wetter than you planned on getting.

So make this a family tradition and come for a relaxing pedal boat ride on our beautiful Mineral Springs Park Lagoon.

We typically perform six productions in our main season, September through May, along with a musical revue in June, our Summer Youth Theatre in August, a holiday performance in December, and a New Year's Eve special.

name: Chillicothe Historical Society
description:
Chillicothe Historical Society was organized April 6, 1971. Since that time, the members have worked diligently to further their stated mission – to preserve and perpetuate the history of Chillicothe and surrounding areas through written and oral history and related artifacts.

The Society had a dream, a dream to create a permanent home for it’s numerous historical treasures and documents. With some patience and a lot of persistence, in 1980, this dream became a reality with the acquisition of the 1889 Rock Island RR depot at Third and Cedar Streets. After much work, this building was dedicated as a museum on May 21, 1987. In August 1987, a 1929 Santa Fe caboose was obtained to display alongside the depot.

Come wander among the reminders of railroading when it was young. The depot’s original interior is home to a treasure trove of Santa Fe as well as Rock Island railroad memorabilia. Kid and adults alike will enjoy the fully operational model railroad which chugs cheerily around the former baggage room, and is a delightful addition to this unique museum experience.

Focused on its mission to preserve the history of Chillicothe and surrounding areas, the Society was rapidly accumulating artifacts donated by area residents. Renting the basement of the First Baptist Church to use as another museum space in 1987 helped immensely, but they soon outgrew the space.

In 2000, the Historical Society, assisted through a generous monetary donation by a longtime Chillicothe family, acquired the 1928 Avery/Dr. Dolph house at 723 N Fourth Street.

The Society had doubled its dream – two museums! The Society was indeed fortunate to obtain such a gracious setting to showcase its exhibits of period clothing, a vintage kitchen and old schoolroom, collections of unique Chillicothe business artifacts, military, local fire and rescue memorabilia, and much more. A third museum building, the “Cottage” out back – is home to Chillicothe’s rich river heritage, and contains exhibits of 19th and 20th century rural living and transportation native wildlife and local pre-history.

Native American history, genealogy and a research department occupies part of the main floor of the main museum. Materials available for use include family histories, census records, plat books, county history books, cemetery records, area photos and more.

The Society is proud to have historic photographs copied in organized binders for the public to view and examine, while safely storing the originals. Photos available include family photos as well as town, river, and rural views and activities. Quality copies of original photos may be purchased.

Our business banking, lending and cash management solutions give you the tools you need to keep your business successful and nimble. Our participation in a wide variety of specialized programs and in-house credit expertise allow us to tailor commercial lending packages to your unique situation and make faster credit decisions. Busey knows that cash flow is the lifeblood of a business—whether you need help with receivables, payables, liquidity, fraud protection or information reporting, we can customize your cash management solution to your growing business' needs.You've earned it. We'll grow it. Busey Wealth Management provides asset management, investment and fiduciary services to individuals, businesses and foundations. We build a team of local professionals around your needs to establish the best strategy for your situation. We work closely with you to develop a personal, comprehensive plan that will help you meet your goals and objectives through each phase of the wealth management process.

name: Bushwhacker
description:
Come in the store to meet the experts in their unnatural habitat.  On course. Off-road. Or in the middle of a downhill adventure. We've used the equipment and outdoor gear we stock on the shelves. And we can tell you about it.

TURNING THE LEARNING CURVE INTO A LIFETIME OF ADVENTURE.
At Bushwhacker, we sell outdoor gear to two different types of people — those who don't know where to start, and those who never know when to stop. No matter which group you fit into, you'll find the resources you need here to improve your performance and share your passion for the great outdoors.

With our roots in backpacking and hiking, the store has changed a lot, since cleats and climbing rope were among its top sellers. Today, Bushwhacker is one of the area's largest bike shops, with a broad assortment of kayaks, clothing, backpacks, and other outdoor gear that changes with every season. But for all those who've walked through the doors of this local Peoria store, it continues to be something more.

For the beginner, it's the starting point, where advice is free, and questions are always encouraged. And for the pros, it's the connecting point — the one place where they return time and time again to share their passion for sport. And perhaps more than anything, it's that atmosphere of collective exploration that keeps Rich invested after 50 years of retail. In fact, 2021 is Bushwhacker's 50th anniversary. "You can't package that sort of vibe. That's real. That's us." And that's why Bushwhacker continues to be one of Illinois' greatest original brands.

name: The Quilt Corner
description:
Originally established in 1988, The Quilt Corner changed ownership in 2013 to proudly carry on the Quilt Corner's legacy of quality and service. With over 75 years of combined quilting experience, their products and services are backed by knowledgeable, enthusiastic staff members, who genuinely care about helping out customers succeed at quilting!

With over 5000 square feet of floor space, they're able to provide the Morton, IL, quilting community with over 3000 bolts of designer fabrics, including a wide range of wools and flannels, to inspire their creativity and support a wide range of project styles. They're also well known for our quilt kits, with an ample selection of projects for quilters of all skill levels. Customers also enjoy a unique selection of gift items and novelty merchandise to compliment every season.

They offer a full schedule of classes and clubs covering skills such as English paper piecing, embroidery, wool applique, and machine quilting. Whether you're new to quilting, just want to perfect your skills, or you're looking for new creative challenges, The Quilt Corner's inventory of on-trend products and equipment is ready to accommodate your project needs and enhance your quilting experience.

Cesar and his wife Karla have a great love for the arts and are big supporters of the arts in the community. Casa de Arte also serves as a gallery for local artists and supports them in selling their art.

name: The Pie Doctor
description:
I am Rebecca Dieter, a veterinarian turned stay at home mom and home baker.  I learned my way around the kitchen from my mom.  Not only did she teach me how to bake fantastic pies from scratch, she also taught me that there's nothing more important than family.  When I was growing up, sharing a pie was a family event, and it often started with the fruit.  We picked and pitted cherries, and peeled and sliced apples that we grew on our farm.  When the work was done, we would gather around the table to laugh, remember, and share our stories.  

Pie time was family time.  So after practicing small animal medicine and surgery for 11 years, I decided to devote myself full time to my own family.  I am grateful to my husband, our two young sons, and the rest of my family, for supporting me now as a home baker.  As "The Pie Doctor" I want to make delicious pies that bring your family and friends together, like they do for us.

name: Illinois River Road National Scenic Byway
address: 11304 N Prairie Rd  The Nature Conservancy  Lewistown  , IL  61542
description:
The heart of Illinois beats true and strong in the communities that make up the Illinois River Road National Scenic Byway. This route - from Ottawa in the north to Havana in the south - is filled with breathtaking wonders of nature, rich history and culture, exciting recreational experiences and welcoming shops and restaurants. For warm, Midwestern hospitality and authentic experiences, follow the river - the Illinois River Road!

 

Illinois River Road - Northern Leg

Spanning from Ottawa to Princeton, 1.5-2 hours from Chicagoland area, Rockford or Davenport, IA

Leave the concrete jungle behind and travel to an area that always welcomes visitors in search of new adventures and tributes from the past. The northernmost span of the Illinois River Road allows you to explore mile after mile of well-marked hiking trails, each with its own set of surprises. Climb up towering canyons and hear the rush of amazing waterfalls or get a glimpse of young fawns frolicking on the colorfully-carpeted forest floor. Water lovers can paddle serenely in a canoe along the banks of quiet inlets or ramp up the adventure with a frothy, whitewater rafting trip. Whether your eyes are trained to the skies in search of a bald eagle or focused on finding one of Illinois’ five remaining covered bridges, you’re sure to see a land of thrills and history along the northern leg of the Illinois River Road.

 

Illinois River Road - Central Leg

From Henry through Peoria to Pekin, 2-3 hours from either Chicago, St. Louis or Indianapolis

Lions, tigers and bison? Oh my! Discover creatures both native and foreign when you visit the middle portion of the Illinois River Road. Overlook herds of majestic bison and elk as they graze in gently-rolling green pastures or observe wolves, foxes and bears as they nestle in their wooded surroundings.  With the chance to see exotic animals such as giraffes, lions, zebras, tigers, wallabies and more, your journey in central Illinois can easily transcend to the lands of Africa, Asia and Australia as well. After this walk-on-the-wild-side, consider unwinding on the water as Calliope music welcomes you aboard an authentic paddlewheel-driven boat that gently makes its way along the banks of the Illinois River. Or stop in for a day of exploration and fun inside the planetarium, children’s discovery center, galleries or manufacturing exhibits at one of several local museums. Whether making animal acquaintances or stimulating the senses, there’s lots to see and do along the central portion of the Illinois River Road.

 

Illinois River Road - Southern Leg

Canton down to Havana, an easy day-trip from Bloomington, Champaign or Quincy

Tune out the sounds and stress of the modern world with a visit to the southern stretch of the Illinois River Road.  A trip here will allow you to immerse yourself inside thousands of acres of wildlife refuge –pristine land where birds, fish and other wildlife are waiting to be discovered. Pull out the binoculars for a glimpse at a majestic bald eagle, osprey or migrating pelican, or just sit back and listen to the melody of an area songbird, with only the rustling of the trees as its accompanist. Boaters and anglers-alike will find it hard to resist the allure of the many marshes, lakes and riverfront banks dotted throughout the region. Whether you hunt, canoe or camp, your commune with the outdoor world can also include time at a museum that pays tribute to the lives and history of the Native Americans who called this land home for 12,000 years. Nowhere are the wonders of nature more apparent than in the southern portion of the Illinois River Road.
