address: 7706 North Grand Prairie Drive Peoria , IL 61615
description:
Cierra Sargent found her passion for baking while she was a student at Bradley. A college part-time- job became a long joyful baking journey. These humble beginnings made Cierra’s passion and creativity grow stronger. She is a self-taught baker and adds a very special touch to all her treats. 

Sugar Frenzy is more than a Bakery, it is a place for others to experience the joy of baking. Baking classes are often taking place and families are creating new lasting memories. These unique baking experiences are open for all to enjoy. 

Cierra encourages customers to be transparent about their experience at Sugar Frenzy and is always open to new recipes. She strives to provide customers with personalized experiences by baking flavorful treats with the most memorable presentations. At Sugar Frenzy you can find cakes, cupcakes, cookies, and more.

name: Trinity Centers
description: At Trinity, we are committed to providing the highest quality care possible in a professional, safe, and educated environment. We take the time to listen, research, and create a comprehensive care plan that addresses your specific needs. Our aim is to build a lifelong relationship with every patient focused on consistent care from our highly educated staff. Conveniently located in Peoria, our dispensaries offer premium quality cannabis products accompanied by unmatched concierge-level of service. In addition, we utilize modern technology to create an immersive and innovative experience. Our products are presented with digital displays that provide all of the information necessary to ensure that you find the right solution for each and every ailment.

name: Troy Ummel's Connected
description: CONNECTED "Passion for exceptional dining".  A Classic American Restaurant with a lot of Italian Flare. Offering exceptional menu choices, quality food and superior customer service. Don't miss the elegant Italian bistro style interior with a 22 foot waterfall. It's a dining experience that you will tell everyone about.

name: Jon Buckley Memorial Garden
description:
Jon Buckley was killed by a tragedy and has left behind family and friends, just like so many others in our Peoria area who have left loved ones behind. As a result of these tragedies, this Garden will stand as a reminder and is surrounded by the love that still exists in this community. It is shaped in the form of a heart to be a constant reminder for us to value life, as we remember those killed by tragedies and who are left forever in our hearts.

Jon Buckley Memorial Garden has a colorful selections of perennials and annuals. Park benches are donated by individuals and the benches are engraved with the name of the donor. It is located behind the RiverPlex at 600 NE Water Street in Peoria, Illinois.

name: Ulrich Wildlife Preserve
description: Located in Morton, Ulrich Wildlife Preserve is a beautiful area with many hiking and walking trails. The trails have a creek running through them, making this a great location to bring kids to play!

name: Logan Recreation Center
description:
If you are looking for a great space for you or your family to spend some time on the South Side of Peoria, head over to the Logan Recreation Center!  The Logan Recreation Center has a slew of outdoor activity areas including three outdoor lighted basketball courts, a soccer field, a kickball area, picnic areas, a water playground, and more!  The inside of the Rec Center is filled with great space including a lounge with computer access available and a multi-purpose recreation room.  Logan Recreation Center also has after-school programs that offer homework help and many fun sporting and recreational activities!

description: This warm, inviting spot near downtown Peoria is an excellent place to get your natural locks refreshed.  The cost is affordable and the stylists work with you to create an attractive style that lasts.  Try TuTu's and see for yourself!

description: Take a step back into the 1950's at The 50's Diner in Peoria, IL. Come experience the great home cooked food and fun atmosphere. Come by today and try our famous Loosey Sammich or any of our other tasty dishes on the menu. Visit The 50's Diner today, where sarcasm is served all day.

Just as you were converted to craft beers after sipping your first microbrew, you’re sure to be won over by the quality of craft whiskey. Group-friendly tours and tastings available.

name: Stoney Creek Hotel & Conference Center
description:
Stoney Creek Hotel & Conference Center offers 164 beautiful guest rooms & suites, with unique amenities that break free from the standard run-of-the-mill hotel accommodations you may be used to – giving you a hotel experience that will leave you refreshed and relaxed! Business and leisure travelers alike enjoy our stone fireplace suites, whirlpool suites, free hot breakfast, free WI-FI, business center, fitness center, heated indoor/outdoor swim-through pool and a unique lodge-themed décor.

Stoney Creek's Northwoods Conference Center is also one of Peoria’s largest conference facilities. Our tenured, full-time team of sales and event coordinators has been recognized by local and regional organizations for their ability to execute successful and memorable events – both large and small. This combination makes Stoney Creek Hotel and Conference Center – Peoria one of the premier venues in Peoria, Illinois.

Specializing in homemade ice cream, along with fudge, specialty candies and dozens of sodas to choose from.  Try the fun Bean Boozled or War Head challenge!. name: Weaver Park
description:
Weaver Park was gifted to the Park District in February 1971. Weaver Park consists of 7 acres along the south of the TP&W Railway just off Lawndale.

Weaver Park features a scenic nature trail that runs along Farm Creek. It is great place for a quick getaway into nature.

name: The Blend Coffee
description: Drinking better coffee is defining. As a part of this unique community, this is The Blend’s contribution The Blend is much more than Washington’s local coffee shop. They have a section of their menu dedicated to signature drinks which are crafted in house. Their whole beans are expertly picked and sourced from countries all over the world. The Blend roasts on site twice weekly to provide the best possible product for their customers. They utilize the whole spectrum of roast profiles, from light to dark, to offer a variety of cups that suit different and unique people. They have numerous Blends and the largest selection of single origins in the area.

name: Country Club BBQ
address: 2510 W Farmington Rd, West Peoria, IL 61604
description:
Cocktails, Live Music, DJ's, & Great BBQ All Under One Roof!...Come in for Lunch, Dinner, or Late Night...Open 11am-2am...7 Days A week!!

Country Club BBQ is Peoria's ONLY place to eat, drink, and dance the night away! Offering a full menu from lunch til late night, The Country Club's BBQ will blow you away. All of our meat is locally raised, and is butchered daily right down the street at Raber Meat Packing Co. The meat is delivered fresh daily and slow cooked in our very own smokers!! If you like to dance, The Country Club has got you covered! Our state of the art entertainment system allows our DJ's to play all of your favorite country hits, while music videos are displayed on our many TV's throughout the club! The Country Club is THE ONLY place in town for live country music. Catch local and national acts playing your favorite songs on our indoor and outdoor stages!! You're guaranteed to love our beautiful beer garden, featuring dart boards, TV's, a fire pit, and full bar!! So if you enjoy a frosty mug of beer, finger lickin' BBQ, and singin' along to a good ol' country tune, THE COUNTRY CLUB IS THE PLACE FOR YOU!

name: Quality Inn & Suites - Peoria
description:
The Quality Inn & Suites® hotel in Peoria, IL near the Peoria Riverfront gives you more value for your hard-earned money.
 
Our pet-friendly Peoria hotel is conveniently located near the Northwoods Mall, which offers countless dining and entertainment options. We are also close to many popular attractions like Illinois Central College, General Wayne A. Downing Peoria International Airport, Peoria Zoo, Wildlife Prairie Park, Peoria Riverfront Museum and:
 Louisville Slugger Sports Complex
 Bradley University
 Illinois Central College
 Dozer Park
 Limelight Eventplex
 
Business travelers will appreciate our business center and access to copy and fax services. Additional amenities at our Peoria hotel offer so much value you'll feel like you found a bargain and include:
 Free breakfast
 Free WiFi
 Indoor heared pool and whirlpool
 Fitness center
 Guest laundry facilities
 
All spacious guest rooms include flat-screen TVs, refrigerators, microwaves, coffee makers, hair dryers, irons and ironing boards. Some rooms have whirlpools and kitchen facilities.
 Get your money's worth at the Quality Inn & Suites. Peoria, IL hotels like ours, you get an affordable hotel with all the amenities you expect, whether on business travel, a weekend getaway or vacation. Book now!

name: UNDERDOG Sports & Fanfare
description:
UNDERDOG Sports, Memorabilia & Games was founded to serve Central Illinois with a place to buy used, but perfectly good equipment and games at affordable prices.

We sell NEW & USED sporting goods.

We RECYCLE sporting goods in order to reduce waste and save you money.

Please consider donating or selling to us. Your gear will help the less fortunate, local kids that need a mentor, educational and after school assistance, or just a place to play. Our proceeds have supported and will continue to support local schools, local sports teams, cancer research, lung research, crisis nurseries, less fortunate mom support and more.

Let's keep kids into sports and out of trouble!

name: Five Points Washington
description:
If you are looking for a top quality fitness center in the Peoria area, search no further. Five Points Washington is the perfect place to get fit! A large multi-purpose facility that offers a complete fitness center, an aquatics center featuring a leisure pool and a competition pool, 2 court gymnasium with elevated walking track, senior center, youth birthday party packages, juice bar, 7,000 square feet of banquet/meeting room space, 1020 seat performing arts center. So whether you are planning your next business meeting, rehearsal dinner, community event or your wedding be sure to check out our facility! You will not be disappointed! So whether you are planning your next business meeting, rehearsal dinner, community event or your wedding be sure to check out our facility! You will not be disappointed!

The Caterpillar Performing Arts Center is a clean, modern and comfortable venue that hosts the Peoria Area Civic Chorale and the Heartland Festival Orchestra as well as various forms of entertainment throughout the year!

name: Unitypoint Health Junction Medical
address: 5901 N Prospect Rd Suite 101B Peoria , IL 61614
description: Direct Primary Care is about more than office visits, it’s about going beyond to provide a full spectrum of health and wellness services. With Direct Primary Care, we’re changing the way health care is paid for. You’ll pay a monthly fee to be part of this innovative practice, and we don’t bill insurance. Junction Medical provides same and next day appointments and can help you with all of your medical needs.

name: Khoury's Cuisine
description: Is there anything more exciting than a great Mediterranean restaurant? Perhaps a great Mediterranean restaurant with a modern spin. Khoury’s delivers unbelievable traditional items like everyone’s favorite choice, the gyro. But we also have some amazing gyro burgers and other hybrids like the garlic chicken wrap, the Philly cheesesteak, homemade and flavorful kibbeh, and exquisite falafels. And no proper Mediterranean establishment would be complete without baklava, and we’ve got that, too – sweet, flaky and delicious, exactly as it should be.

name: Peoria Rivermen Hockey Club
description:
One of the longest running hockey teams in North America, is proud to call the Peoria Civic Center (Carver Arena) and Downtown Peoria home for over the past 40 years.  The Peoria Rivermen have been in continuous operation since the 1982-83 season (one of the the 7th longest continually operating minor league hockey franchises in North America).  The Rivermen have played in the International Hockey League (1982-96), the East Coast Hockey League (1996-2005), the American Hockey League (2005-2013) and now call the Southern Professional Hockey League (2013-present) home . 

The Rivermen have won four League Championships, two in the International Hockey League, one in the ECHL and now in 2022, in the Southern Professional Hockey League.  The Rivermen are the only franchise in all of North America to have won a league championship in each level of the sport and have the best winning percentage in the history of the SPHL over the course of the past nine seasons.  The Rivermen pride themselves in promoting a winning hockey team on the ice, at an affordable family price, with entertainment on and off the ice from start to finish of each game.

name: Odie's
description: A small, quiet place for gaming, food and drinks with friends. Featuring a salad bar, soups, sandwiches and appetizers, local wines, whiskeys and beers. Try out a cocktail next time you're in the Chillicothe area! They also have a private gaming area and do event rentals.

description: Pekin // Leaves 'n Beans roasts all of their coffees. They have an extensive selection of loose leaf tea. Their Cafes have a large selection of breakfast items, lunch items, salads, wraps, paninis & café sandwiches. They offer drive thru windows in Morton & Pekin. They have an online app to help customers order ahead for pickup and delivery service through their app or Doordash.

name: Rising Tide Station
address: 2401 N Main Street East Peoria , IL 61611
description:
Born in Michoacan, Mexico, Rogelio Retugin immigrated with his family to Peoria when he was just 11 years old. He remembers how warmhearted and supportive the community was toward him and his family. This made a long-lasting positive impact in his life and this motivated him to give back to the community. 

Rising Tide Station opened its doors in August 2021. This is the third business Rogelio proudly owns and operates in the greater Peoria area. Rising Tide Station is a store for outdoor enthusiasts and features merchandise that rotates seasonally and customers can expect to always find something new!

Rogelio’s biggest motivation comes from raising his son. He is passionate about teaching his son to always give back to the community that supported him and his family when they first arrived in the United States.

address: 4700 N University St Suite 61 Peoria , IL 61614
description: The Balanced Bee Juice & Broth Restorative displays founder, Annie Parks’ active approach to lifelong balance + well-being. Learn to optimize the benefits of raw juice + mineral-dense bone broth through our menu. This is liquid food medicine, shared in a modern, convenient and healthy environment.

description: Located on the historic town square, Timeless Treasure Market showcases locally made products like bath bombs, seasonal decor, and more. As a fun outing, check their events for crafting classes.

name: Baked Blessings by Lisa
description: Baked Blessings by Lisa is a fully licensed bake shop located in Morton IL. They specialize in custom ordered sweets such as hand decorated sugar cookies, cupcakes, cake truffles, cookie cakes and so much more. They do not keep items on hand to purchase as their sweets require advance notification for ordering. Please inquiry about their availability to make your day sweeter!

name: Vanilla Bug Spray
description:
Vanilla Bug Spray is a product that works for the entire family. It contains no harsh chemicals and is safe on children and pets. It is the perfect addition to any outdoor activity.

Being outdoors is so important to many families and especially to mine. We were tired of harsh chemicals and stinky bug sprays. So, here we are. I originally had the plan to create something for my granddaughters so they could play outside without worrying about bug bites.

name: The Simple Things
description: Located in historic downtown Famington, stop by The Simple Things to secure all of your modern rustic farmhouse home decor.

name: Bradley University
address: Bradley University 1501 W. Bradley Avenue Peoria , IL  61625
description: BRADLEY UNIVERSITY is a top-ranked private university in Peoria, Illinois, that offers nearly 6,000 undergraduate and graduate students opportunities and resources of a larger university and the personal attention and exceptional learning experience of a smaller university. Bradley offers more than 185 undergraduate and graduate academic programs in business, communications, education, engineering, fine arts, health sciences, liberal arts and sciences, and technology. These high-quality programs incorporate global and experiential learning opportunities, preparing graduates to succeed in a complex world.

description:
***At this time, The Gateway Building is not currently accepting weddings + events.

The Gateway Building is the focal point of Peoria's Riverfront.  This is an affordable, convenient site for any meeting, banquet, weddings or conference occasion.

Whether you are planning your dream wedding or a fun event for your business, the Gateway Building on the Peoria Riverfront has you covered! The Gateway Building has various rooms available to rent that can accommodate guest lists of up to 290 people. The Gateway Building’s exclusive list of caterers will make your event planning easy and tasty! Amenities include rentals, special events, and weddings.

name: SimplyFit 4U
address: 841 W. Main Street Suite B Peoria , IL 61606
description:
Angel and Maria Caballero moved to Peoria in October 2017. The decision for the move was made while visiting family over the holidays the year before. They fell in love with the natural beauty of Peoria and wanted to experience it all year long. The Caballeros have been on a healthy lifestyle journey for the past decade and wanted to bring their knowledge and experience to Peoria and help others find their way. 

Angel is a passionate wellness coach that works hard to give long-term results to each of his clients. Angel understands the struggles of living an unhealthy lifestyle and wants to help his clients be healthy and successful. He uses his story to motivate others and show that simple changes make a big difference.

Every Protein shake blended at SimplyFit 4 U is personalized for customers.
Angel and Maria Caballero take pride in the customer service they provide to everyone that walks through their doors. To this couple, wellness starts with kindness and care. Both are passionate about nutrition and helping others find a way to a healthier lifestyle.

name: Welton Strength and Performance
address: 1320 W. Northmoor Road Suite B Peoria , IL 61614
description: WSP focuses on sports performance and adult fitness training specific to you, to perform the way you have always wanted! James Welton is CPT, Pn1 and his former Coaching Experience is D1 Strength & Conditioning.

name: The Warehouse on State
address: 736 SW Washington 736 SW Washington Peoria , IL  61602
description: The Warehouse on State is a brand new event center located in the Warehouse District in downtown Peoria, IL. Featuring state of the art technology and lighting with an urban and industrial feel, The Warehouse on State is the area’s newest and most progressive event space. Situated within walking distance of many downtown attractions including: the Illinois River, downtown bars, entertainment, lodging and restaurants, we will be able to provide you with the ability to host your perfect event. The Warehouse on State can accommodate up to 350 guests for any occasion or gathering that you can dream of!

name: Weavers Fresh Food and Drink
description: Made from scratch pizza, sandwiches, famous chicken fingers, lemon shakeups, full bar and game room for kids! Convenient side door carryout counter, outdoor seating and 9 TV’s for your sports viewing pleasure!

name: Meet Me On Madison
description: A fresh, new modern venue cafe located in downtown Peoria, where breakfast is available all day. We also offer event/venue space. Book us now for your next event!

name: Raber Packing Co.
address: 3000 W Farmington Rd West Peoria , IL 61604
description:
We are a local company through and through. Since we started in 1954, our goal always has been to provide the best local meat – everything from beef and pork to poultry and other livestock. We source our products from local farmers, many who have been raising livestock for decades. Along with being good for the local economy, supporting local farmers has environmental and health benefits as well.

Meat is what makes our Raber’s special, and that’s because we don’t sell just any meat. We source our meat locally which means better flavor. Supermarkets typically get their meat from industrial farms. Local farmers put more time and care into their livestock, and many grass feed their animals organically with no antibiotics or preservatives. The end result is juicier, more flavorful meat that’s healthier than supermarket-bought meat.

name: Stag Tap
description: Located in the middle of downtown Havana, the Stag Tap is a local favorite!  Known for great times, fun and music, it's where visitors come to unwind and have a good time and it's the place Havana natives love to come home to.  You always know if you stop in at the Stag Tap, you can catch up with friends or make some new ones!

name: Laser Ops Mobile Gaming
description: Laser Ops Mobile Gaming has Illinois' most exciting video game truck and laser tag party options. Family and veteran owned, they service the Greater Peoria area with a mobile entertainment party that is affordable and exciting. They are self-powered, fully climate controlled and can go just about anywhere!

name: Becks Florist Inc
address: 105 E Washington St, East Peoria, IL 61611
description: Full service FTD florist offering contemporary, European high style and novelty designs since 1934. Featuring balloons, plush toys, wedding and party decorations, as well as acrylic and oil lamp candelabra rentals. Plant leasing and maintenance division, blooming and green plants. Two locations, in Peoria and East Peoria.

name: Pure Oasis Hair and Beauty Salon
description:
Pure Oasis is an upscale salon that caters to all ethnicity of hair! Come to the Oasis for the ultimate experience!

Jamar Harden has been cutting hair as far back as he can remember. Helping others look and feel good has always been a passion of his. Growing up he remembers cutting his family's hair and enjoying the process. His talent was undeniable by the time he reached college. Classmates were soon lining up outside his door requesting his services. 

Born and raised in Peoria, Jamar has always had a special place in his heart for his hometown. He is happy to see the growth, and opportunities that members of the community have to make 

their dreams of business ownership come true and to see the help that is available to help them thrive. Pure Oasis Hair and Beauty Salon is more than just a dream come true for Jamar. His business is a representation of what hard work and dedication can create for anyone willing to put the work in. 

“This is the best time to live in Peoria”, he says. A wave of young entrepreneurs are making their dreams come true in this city every day. Jamar wants to create an experience for everyone that walks through his doors, by providing all his customers with a great space that makes them feel welcomed, and valued.

vibemap_images.title: Pure Oasis Hair and Beauty Salon

name: Hoop's Pub and Pizza
description: Hoops Pub and Pizza is YOUR Downtown Peoria pizza joint! Stop by before, during and after sporting events and try out their great pizza and drink options! Just across the street from the Pere Marquette Hotel and 2 blocks from the Peoria Civic Center. With outdoor dining available, Hoops is a popular spot for afternoon drinks or post-game snacks.

name: The Cottage Peddler
description: Quaint shop located on the square in Metamora, IL. We are located in a historic 200 year old home. We offer refurbished furniture, home decor, boutique clothing, jewelry, toys, baby boutique, local artists and more!

name: Commerce Bank
description: Full service banking. Main bank downtown Peoria within two blocks of Peoria Civic Center and various hotels.

name: Washington Family Restaurant
description: Washington Family Restaurant is your spot for homestyle cooking with breakfast served all day! The extensive menu includes build-your-own skillet, an endless variety of combination plates, omelets, and pancakes—making this diner an ‘egg’cellent start to your day.

address: 4544 N. Prospect Rd Peoria Heights , IL 61616

description: Learn how to glide along on a Segway with World on Wheels.  Peoria area’s only Segway tour and Quadracycle bike rental experience. Offering 30-minute, 1-hour, and 2-hour Segway tours as well as 30-minute Quadracycle bike rides. Gliding with World On Wheels is as fun as it gets. Use them for individual riding or corporate events.  Open March thru November, weather permitting.  Feel free to call for an appointment @ 453-0916.  Easy riding for all age levels. www.worldonwheelspeoria.com.

name: The Confectionery
description: Since 1976 The Confectionery has kept the tradition of fresh baked goods alive in central Illinois. For over 40 years, we have continued to use the original recipes for our pies, cookies, coffeecakes and other baked goods. Whether you have a family gathering, workplace event, or a special occasion you can count on The Confectionery to provide you with high quality, fresh, baked from scratch desserts.

name: The Cookery
description:
From the Field Cooking School and Catering, located in Morton, Illinois. Owner, William Turney is thrilled to share his passion for cooking with the Peoria Area. From the Field offers a variety of cooking classes and catering services. Classes are hands on; and From the Field is happy to build a class around your needs… just tell them what you’re looking for! There’s something for everyone: from couples’s classes to knife skills, kitchen rentals to corporate outings, and custom baked goods made just to your liking. Come join the fun at From the Field Cooking School and Catering in Morton.
From the Field Cooking School is culinary education center designed for the everyday person. We teach you how to prepare great meals, cooking techniques, the science of cooking, kitchen safety and sanitation, some food history and other useful information presented in clear easy to understand and entertaining manner.
We offer Hands-on Cooking classes, demonstration classes, couple's night, corporate team building, private group cooking classes and offer commercial kitchen rental.
www.fromthefieldcookingschool.com
Kaci's Places to Play in Peoria - From the Field

The Cookery Inc is a cooking school and catering company. We teach classes to ages 5 and up for children as well as a large variety of topics for adults. We teach a lot of classes on ethnic cuisine, have classes for the ladies and for couples as well. We cater large and small events, mostly buffet style. We can even host a small group of up to 60 in our facility. We also have a frozen gourmet to-go menu that is available for in-store pickup.

name: Tavern on Prospect
address: 5901 N Prospect Rd Suite 10 Peoria , IL 61614
description: Tavern on Prospect is an upscale pub and eatery with tasty signature cocktails and bar food. They have an outdoor beer garden as well as drink specials and video gaming. Stop by for a meal and a few drinks!

name: Baymont Inn and Suites - Peoria
address: 2002 W. War Memorial Dr. Peoria , IL  61614
description:
Whether you are looking to escape the city or are staying for business, our Peoria hotel off Interstate 74 offers all the conveniences to make your stay comfortable and relaxing. The Caterpillar world headquarters is three miles away. 

A stay at our Peoria hotel can make your business or leisure trip a lot more fun. Relax by our heated outdoor pool, enjoy a workout in our gym, watch your favorite cable TV show or dine at nearby restaurants. Start your day with free hot breakfast and a copy of USA Today. Browse online with free Wi-Fi in the comfort of your room, or get work done in our business center. Our hotel in Peoria is pet friendly.

name: Sunrise Health Foods
description: Sunrise Health Foods is a grocery and health store that sells a fully organic produce selection, the highest quality vitamins, minerals, and herbs available, a large selection of healthy foods and gluten-free products, fresh juice and smoothies, and natural health, beauty and household products. Sunrise Health Foods' team lives everyday with the purpose of improving their health and yours.

name: Roth Turkey Farm
description:
Roth Turkey Farm is an independent, family-owned and operated turkey farm located in Forrest, IL (serving Central Illinois).  It was established by Ken & Deb Roth in 1988 and has been continuously serving the local communities. 

Since 2000, We offer fresh (never frozen), all natural, processed, federally-inspected turkeys for Thanksgiving and Christmas at our farm in Forrest IL (Central IL) - serving Livingston, McLean, Iroquois, and Ford Counties and surrounding areas. We are located off of Route 47 - South of Forrest, IL.  Our turkeys are all natural, all vegetable diet, with nothing added or injected.

Actually, contrary to popular belief, turkeys are a beautiful animal.  The coloring on their heads and necks is stunning.

name: The Feed Store and Wineinger Farm
description:
The Feed Store is a twist on farm to table dining located in Princeville. This family dinner diner is open Monday through Saturday from 4-9pm serving up your favorite American classics.

name: Blue Margarita's Mexican Bar & Grill- Washington
description:
Esteban Pascual is living the American dream in Peoria. He fell in love with Peoria at first sight and moved here in 2008 years from Oaxaca, Mexico. The rich culture in Peoria instantly attracted him and he knew he wanted to be part of the community. 

He started working at local restaurants and there he met Ricardo Martinez, who later would be his business partner. The two had a dream of one day owning their own restaurant. Their hard work paid off and years later they were in a partnership for their first restaurant, Blue Margaritas. Blue Margaritas was  
successful and allowed the partners to open other locations in and around
the greater Peoria area. 

Esteban continued his restaurant expansion by opening Molcajete Mexican Restaurant in Chillicothe. He  encourages others to give Peoria a chance and take part in the growth of the city.

name: Blue Ridge Community Farm
address: 21529 N Blue Ridge Road Chillicothe , IL 61523
description:
Blue Ridge Community Farm is a 245-acre working farm for adults and children with special needs located approximately 4 miles northwest of Chillicothe, Illinois.

Currently, we offer educational field trips for special education and life skills classes. There is no charge for a school to come and visit the farm. Our field trips typically include interacting with our farm animals, music, crafts, hay rack rides (dependent upon the size of the group) and learning opportunities revolving around crops grown on the farm, animal care and general farm knowledge. We are home to ten alpacas, four donkeys, chickens, a horse and two golden retrievers.

We also offer social events for adults with special needs all at no charge to those that attend. Some of our events include an annual square dance, cookouts and campfire sing-a-longs.

The hotel is centrally located, just minutes from I-74, Hwy 24, Hwy 150, downtown Peoria, and Peoria International Airport (PIA). Business travelers can benefit from the proximity of our Holiday Inn Express & Suites East Peoria hotel to many nearby companies including Caterpillar, IBM, OSF Saint Francis Medical Center, Komatsu, Bradley University, and Illinois Central College. Our 100% nonsmoking hotel offers leisure travelers easy access to the Bass Pro Shop, Peoria Civic Center, Eastside Centre Sports Complex, Par-A-Dice Casino, Caterpillar Visitors Center, Peoria Zoo, and Peoria Riverfront Museum. All hotel guests can enjoy a variety of amenities including upgraded room types, indoor pool, fitness center, and meeting space. Our pantry and snack shop offers a wide selection of food and beverage choices including beer and wine. And our upscale Great Room provides a large, spacious, soft seating social gathering area with large flat panel HD TVs. Whatever the reason for your stay, your experience at the Holiday Inn Express & Suites East Peoria - Riverfront hotel will be a memorable one!

As members, you can have access all chamber events and meetings, both Business to Business and Business to Consumer. 

If you would like to join the Chamber, visit www.peoriaheightschamber.com for more information and to apply. As a visitor, you can experience city life in a small town, with all of its charm and beauty. You can walk the downtown street of the Historic Peoria Heights Village and find many different restaurants and shops. For a list of the many events throughout the year visit our website for more information and come see 'What's Happening in the Heights'!

description:
Rodolfo and Leonora Guzman always had a dream of one day opening their own restaurant. In January of 2020, that dream came true when they opened up Rudy’s Mexican Cantina & Grill in Peoria. Although they faced many challenges over the past year, they have been surrounded by a supportive community that has helped keep their doors open. 

The loyalty of their customers motivates them to keep working hard and give back to local charities. Both have a passion for helping others and getting involved in charity work.  They are happy to be able to run a business that allows them to help others in need.

name: Village of Bradford
description:
Bradford, Illinois 61421

Bradford is located in the northeastern corner of Osceola Township, which is part of Stark County on Illinois State Route 40. Bradford is approximately 35 miles north of Peoria and 65 miles east of the Quad Cities. According to the 2020 census Bradford has a population of 676.

Bradford offers many services to its residents. Bradford has a volunteer fire department and houses a branch of the Stark County Ambulance Service for emergency service to it's residents. Bradford also offers garbage pick up on Thursday mornings and recycling pick up on alternating weeks. Gas and electric service is provided by Ameren. Mediacom provides telephone, cable, and high speed internet service to the village. Bradford has a reverse osmosis water system and city sewer system.

Elsie Drawyer Hodges Park features a beautiful gazebo and shelter along with basketball courts and playground equipment. Bradford Park Board offers summer baseball programs for children 5 years old and up, including T Ball, softball, and baseball. Bradford has the only public swimming pool in Stark County which is open during the summer months for residents of all ages to enjoy. The Bradford Public Library is located adjacent to Elsie Hodges and has many activities for young and not so young alike.

Bradford Community Unit School District #1 serves the Village of Bradford and Bradford School District's rural area. The Bradford Grade School houses Pre-K to 5th grade and the Jr. High grades 6-8. The deactivation of the Bradford High School gives students the option of choosing to attend Bureau Valley High in Manlius or Stark County High School in Toulon. Illinois Central College in East Peoria is the community college that serves the Bradford School District.

Bradford offers a variety of shopping opportunities including: Antique Store, Beauty Shops, Bank, Exercise and Tanning Center, Massage Therapy, Gas Stations, Gift Store, Home Maintenance Services, Insurance Agencies, Restaurants and Bars.

Bradford is served by some very active community organizations including: BETAS (Sigma-Phi Alpha Chapter), Bradford Business Association, Bradford Lions Club, Bradford American Legion, Bradford American Legion Auxiliary, Boy Scouts of America, Girl Scouts, Knights of Columbus, in conjunction with Wyoming and Princeville, TOPS (Take Off Pounds Sensibly), and local church clubs. The Bradford Food Pantry is located at the Leet Memorial Methodist Church and is open Monday and Tuesday 9:00a.m. to noon.

He admired the tranquility and diverseness of the community. While driving around he realized that Peoria would be the perfect place for his next restaurant. 

Jose comes from a long line of family members with a strong work ethic. With the help of his family, he owned his first restaurant at the young age of just 17. This life experience and love for Mexican cuisine have made Jose successful.  He wanted to bring his unique culinary style to Peoria and bring authentic taste like never seen before. 

Jalapenos is family-owned and operated by Jose and his wife Nora who are hands-on and lead their team by example. You can find both of them cleaning tables or taking orders just like other employees. They believe that the customer service they have provided to the community has been one of the keys to their success. They prioritize customer satisfaction and care that everyone has a positive experience at Jalapenos. 

Renovations to their bar are currently underway and this is another way that Jose and Nora care about their customers. They want to provide different experiences for new and returning customers alike. Their bar will be like no other in the area filled with colorful Mexican art and delicious drinks!

name: Rock Island Trail State Park
description:
Beauty and solitude, away from the hustle and bustle of city traffic, await visitors at Rock Island Trail State Park. Stretching for 26 miles from Alta, in Peoria County, to Toulon, in Stark County, the park offers many natural and architectural attractions in a tree-canopied corridor that is only 50 to 100 feet wide.

Prairie grasses and wildflowers co-exist as remnants of early rail travel along the trail. Just north of Alta, an arched culvert provides a lovely backdrop for the natural beauty of the area.  At the Peoria and Stark County line, a tall grass prairie remnant provides a step back into time and allows visitors to see the Illinois that the early settlers experienced. Just a few miles from the Toulon access area, a trestle bridge spans the Spoon River between Wyoming and Toulon. A few miles further south, the Wyoming Chicago, Burlington, and Quincy Depot stands as a mute testimony to the hundreds of passengers who traveled along the railway just 100 years ago.

The new aquatic center is in constant use during the summer, and the lighted softball field attracts teams from throughout the area.  Tennis/Pickleball & basketball courts are located south of the swimming pool, two beautiful pavilions can be found at the north and south ends of the park, a disc golf course and Riggins River Walk provide scenic views of the Illinois River.

With an initial land purchase in 1925, the area has grown to include approximately 6,000 acres, of which half is land and half is water divided into three units.

name: Krab Kingz Peoria
address: 2517 N. Main Street East Peoria , IL 61611
description:
Cooking comes naturally for Chloe Simpson. Her father was a baker and her mother a devoted cook. With the guidance of her parents, Chloe learned her own style of cooking and prepared wonderful meals for her family at an early age.  At 14 Chloe remembers preparing and cooking her first Thanksgiving dinner. It was a feast and a reassurance for young Chloe that her passion was cooking. 

Her family has always been supportive and has encouraged her to pursue her dreams of opening a restaurant. Krab Kingz Seafood is that dream come true for Chloe and her family. East Peoria is home to their family-owned and operated restaurant. They are proud of the quality, and service they provide to the greater Peoria community. 

Krab Kingz Seafood originally opened its doors in December of 2021 and has been welcomed by members of the community. “The amount of support we have received from the community has been so positive,” said Chloe. This positive attitude by community members is what makes our area is so unique and a prosperous community for business owners to invest in.

name: East Bluff Community Center
description:
Located in the heart of Peoria's East Bluff...
 
The East Bluff Community Center (EBCC) is a 501(c)3, non-profit organization located at 512 E. Kansas St. in one of Peoria’s lowest income, but richest historical neighborhoods. With a mission “to foster connections that enrich lives and enhance the East Bluff", we work hard to offer a safe, and welcoming campus. This is a place where individuals, groups, and organizations can host and participate in activities, events, programs, and human services. We strategically partner with many local agencies to bring services and resources directly to the East Bluff, based on what our community wants and needs.

We invite you to explore our website to learn more about the EBCC. Please contact us with any questions or to learn more about what's going on and how you can be involved. All are welcome to visit the community center-- we are here for YOU!

Full of character, memories, and most of all friends, Mike's has stood the test of time. In 2020 Mark Donahue and Bob Bullock purchased Mike's Tavern from the Ward family and have continued the legacy. Might just be the best Garage Bar around according to Colin Knox.

name: The Archbishop Fulton Sheen Museum

Only one block away stands the Cathedral of St. Mary of the Immaculate Conception, where Fulton Sheen learned to serve Mass and was ordained a priest on September 20, 1919.

name: Stark County Board
description:
Stark County, Illinois is located in north-central Illinois and comprises an area of 537 square miles. It is the 40th largest county by population, with a population of 30,564 as of 2019. It is part of the Peoria Metropolitan Statistical Area.

The county seat is Toulon and its largest city is Wyoming. The county gets its name from Revolutionary War hero John Stark who served under General George Washington in the Battle of Bunker Hill.

Stark County covers an area that ranges from flat plains to rolling hills with deep ravines and bluffs along the banks of the Rock River. The climate in Stark County mostly consists of cold winters and warm summers with some rain throughout the year.

The local economy is mainly agricultural, with corn, soybeans, wheat, and hay being the main crops grown in the county. Cattle ranching makes up a small portion of the economy as well. There are also several small manufacturing plants throughout Stark County making plastic products and industrial machinery parts for sale around the globe.

Stark County offers a variety of recreational activities for residents including camping sites along rivers and lakes, hunting opportunities on local wildlife preserves, snowmobiling trails, hiking trails on state parks, biking trails through nature preserves and golf courses throughout town that attract visitors year-round.

In addition to recreation activities, there are plenty of cultural attractions in Stark County such as art galleries showcasing local artists’ work, museums highlighting local history and culture as well as theaters offering live performances of musicals and plays throughout the year.

name: Native Trails Winery
description: Native Trails Winery offers red and white wines made from locally-grown grapes, while its picturesque and winding trails are available for guests to enjoy nature and the beautiful scenery. This 110-acre vineyard is adjacent to Dickson Mounds, a National Historic Site, which provides a distinctive nod toward the land’s Native American roots. Native Trails Winery offers a chance to sip and celebrate the free spirit of an earlier time in history with five dry and four sweet offerings all named after the native Oneota Indians heritage that runs deep in the region.

name: Jay Goldberg Events and Entertainment
description:
Over 38 years experience as Central Illinois leading provider of concerts, festivals, tradeshows and special event services. Entertainment is our specialty. www.jaytv.com
 Jay Goldberg -- A Short Recap
 Jay Goldberg Events and Entertainment is an event and entertainment company established in 1971 to promote major live music concerts and to produce and develop festivals and corporate events. 

 Beginning with the early days of rock n’ roll, Jay has had the pleasure of working with many of the top names in the live music industry and have developed strong relationships with all of the major talent agencies. While rock n’ roll has been a strong focus of this company, JG E&E has diversified and now presents many genres of entertainment including:
 Country • Comedy • Rock n Roll • Jazz • R&B • Blues • World Beat • Variety
 With strong entertainment industry relationships, there is no limit to the size or scope of production that can be produced and presented by Jay Goldberg Events & Entertainment.

 With offices based in Central Illinois, Jay Goldberg Events and Entertainment has produced concerts and individual events throughout the Midwest and other markets from Las Vegas in the West to Key Largo, Florida. We have access to all major markets and are able to facilitate any project from start to finish. We are always interested in looking at new entertainers and venues to work with, and are proud to discuss a possible working relationship with you.

 Concerts & Events
 Jay Goldberg promoted his first concert in 1971. The act was Uriah Heep Live at “The Barn” in Peoria, Illinois. Jay’s son Ian came on board in 1993. Together, there is over 50 years experience in the live entertainment industry. JG E&E have presented in concert over 1,750 acts during this career. A small sampling of the acts worked with include, but is not limited to:  Elton John • Harry Conick Jr. • Wallflowers • Genesis • Grateful Dead • Fleetwood Mac • George Winston • Arlo Guthrie • Allman Brothers • Tina Turner • Kenny G • Whitney Houston • John Mellencamp • Diana Ross • KISS • B.B. King • Marshall Tucker Band • Amy Grant • Fiona Apple • Michael Bolton • REO Speedwagon • Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles • Christmas On Ice With Nancy Kerrigan • NBA pre-season Basketball Game • Team USA Olympic Volleyball

 All aspects of the live concert & event process are handled by Jay Goldberg Events & Entertainment. From the budget process, talent buying and media promotion, to the technical and site production, our staff and network of professionals offer a one-stop company that is Highly recognized in the industry.

name: Nikki Burk Counseling
address: 5901 N Prospect Rd Suite 105 Peoria , IL 61614
description:
It is my belief that all too often in life, we are dealt situations and circumstances we don’t prepare for. We might feel as though we have no support or the proper care we deserve. I feel that therapy can be beneficial in ways that help us understand ourselves in a more positive and healthy way. I encourage putting our mental and physical well-being first, so that we are able to confront the challenges of everyday a little bit easier.

I enjoy helping others find strength within themselves, and using this to lead a productive and beneficial lifestyle. I enjoy working with children, adolescents, adults, and families. I have experience working with behavioral issues, depression, anxiety, grief, trauma/PTSD, and am a productive resource during crisis situations. Among various therapeutic techniques, I believe in and educate others on implementing health and wellness as a treatment approach.

name: Illinois Valley Public
description: Public broadcasters have adopted shared principles to strengthen the trust and integrity that communities expect of valued public service institutions.Public media organizations contribute to a strong civil society and active community life, provide access to knowledge and culture, extend education, and offer varied viewpoints and sensibilities.The freedom of public media professionals to make editorial decisions without undue influence is essential. It is rooted in America's commitment to free speech and a free press. It is reflected in the unique and critical media roles that federal, state, and local leaders have encouraged and respected across the years. It is affirmed by the courts.Trust is equally fundamental. Public media organizations create and reinforce trust through rigorous, voluntary standards for the integrity of programming and services, fundraising, community interactions, and organizational governance.These standards of integrity apply to all the content public media organizations produce and present, regardless of subject matter, including news, science, history, information, music, arts, and culture. These standards apply across all public media channels and platforms - broadcasting, online, social media, print, media devices, and in-person events.

name: Greater Peoria Area Crime Stoppers
description:
Crime Stoppers is comprised of diverse, active, and dedicated community representatives.

The process of calling the Greater Peoria Area Crime Stoppers is simple. You call 309-673-9000, which puts you in contact with the Crime Stoppers call center. An operator will answer the phone and take down the information you wish to provide about a crime. He or she will never ask for your name, number, address, or any other identifying information.

Once you give us information, you will be assigned a code number, which is the only method Crime Stoppers has of identifying you. You must remember this number, and provide it to a Crime Stoppers operator when you call back to check on the status of the information you have given. You must call Crime Stoppers. We cannot call you, because we never ask for your phone number.

In the meantime, we pass your information on to the appropriate law enforcement agency, which takes action based on your information and reports back to us on whether it led to the solving or prevention of a crime.

When you call us back and give us your code number, we check with law enforcement to see whether your information was useful. If it has led to an arrest and indictment, you receive a cash reward.

To receive that reward, we instruct you to come to a public place at a specified time and date, where a Crime Stoppers volunteer make the payment. Rewards are paid out in cash, no matter what the amount.

Crime Stoppers pays a reward of up to $1,000 on all felony crimes committed in Peoria, Tazewell and Woodford Counties.

name: Banner Marsh State Fish and Wildlife Area
description:
Banner Marsh State Fish and Wildlife Area is located approximately 25 miles southwest of Peoria on U.S. Route 24 and is protected from the Illinois River by a major levee. Teeming with fish and wildlife, Banner Marsh provides outdoor activities including hunting, fishing, boating, dog training, picnicking, wildlife observation and photography. Three public access areas lead into Banner Marsh, all of which have parking lots, boat ramps, restrooms and picnic areas. The only type of camping allowed at Banner Marsh is youth group camping. Nearby Rice Lake State Fish and Wildlife Area has camping facilities available.

We hope you enjoy your stay. Remember, take only memories, leave only footprints.

name: Marigold Festival
description:
The Pekin Marigold Festival is always held the weekend after Labor Day in the Marigold Capital of the World - Pekin, Illinois.

Beloved by his hometown, Pekin hosted the first festival in 1973 as a celebration of the late Senator’s legislative legacy. The Pekin Marigold Festival was named in honor of Senator Dirksen, known for championing the Marigold as the national floral emblem. To this day Pekin is recognized as the Marigold Capital of the World. Senator Dirksen was most known for his key roles in passing the Nuclear Test Ban Treaty (1963), the Civil Rights Act of 1964, the Voting Rights Act of 1965, and the Open Housing Act of 1968.

name: Peoria Area Food Bank
description:
One of The Largest Food Banks In Central Illinois, Peoria Area Food Bank Seeks To End hunger in Three Counties By Organizing Food, Information and Support For Community Survival and Dignity.

The Peoria Area Food Bank was formed in 1984 to help supplement the dietary and nutritional needs of low-income families. Counties served by the Peoria Area Food Bank are Peoria, Tazewell, Woodford, Fulton, and Mason counties.

The Food Bank provides 112 active food pantries, soup kitchens, homeless shelters, senior housing, and low-income day-care centers with large quantities of food from name-brand manufacturers and USDA commodities on a daily basis.

In 2009 the food bank distributed over 3,00,000 pounds of food; an increase of approximately 1,087,157 pounds compared to 2008. The Food Bank relies heavily on corporate manufacturers for food donations. It also receives support from individuals and local businesses, and actively participates in the annual Peoria Area Anti-Hunger Coalition Can-a-thon and the National Association of Letter Carriers Food Drive.

If you have more than 200 people, don’t worry.  Just outside of the indoor section is what the Peoria Zoo called “The Village”.  This outdoor space can be used separately or in conjunction with the indoor Lodge.  Using both areas, the Peoria Zoo can accommodate over 1,000 guests.  
In addition to larger spaces, the Zoo also offers two smaller areas for rental in the evening.  These classroom-style rooms have great views into exhibits within the Zoo.

MEETING SPACE:
9,391 sq. ft. of total meeting space
Number of meeting rooms: 4
Largest meeting room:  8,291 sq. ft.

Found in the heart of downtown Peoria, Catrina’s Express provides a unique experience of original recipes found in Hidalgo. Breakfast burritos and quesadillas Hidalgo are among the favorites with customers. The green salsa is also a must-try menu item!

name: City of Canton
description:
The City of Canton is located in Fulton County. This charming little town has a long and fascinating history, filled with inventors and adventurers as diverse as Elizabeth Magie, a contributor to the creation of the Monopoly board game, and Charles Duryea, developer of the first practical automobile. Astronaut Colonel Steve Nagle, the 100th American in space, is from Canton, as is Bill Cook, founder of Cook Group, Inc., the largest privately-held medical device manufacturer in the world. Perhaps fitting, since Canton is surrounded by rich and bountiful farmland, the town is best known for the genius of William Parlin, and his business partner, William Orendorff, who created the P&O Plowworks, which later became International Harvester.

The Canton community today has the same drive for innovation and creative thinking, thriving when other small communities may have lost sight of the very thing that made them special. We cherish our heritage, we take advantage of the opportunities available today, and we can't wait for the future.

Our 14-game season runs mid-May through mid-July, and home games will be played at Bradley University’s Shea Stadium.

description: Sometimes a change in scenery can help everything. Take a walk on the wild side at Cutright Park. With a 50-foot tall observation tower, you can easily spot different animals along the Illinois River. A staircase and two telescopes allow visitors the perfect view of wildlife. Relax in nature as you spot different wildlife with a birds-eye view. Who wouldn’t want to see majestic creatures close up!? You won’t want to miss this river view, and with wildlife and birds at every corner, you can explore the park as well. You’ll have so much fun it should be ill-eagle.

name: Prairie Hills Wetland Reserve
description: This is a varied and beautiful reserve from wetland to bluff.  There is a mowed path in the lower prairie (near the picnic area) or visitors are welcome to make their own paths as long as Leave No Trace principles are followed.  More trails are planned as funding allows.  The lower property (along Dyke Road) is often flooded but is also open to visitors.  The property's conservation purpose is to protect migratory birds, the endangered Indiana Bat, and the federally threatened Decurrent False Aster.  A number of tree identification markers have been placed on the forested hill behind the picnic area.

Peoria, IL has been a hub of activity for centuries. Learn more about what our area has to offer and discover all the reasons to visit The River City.

name: Evergreen Farm Brewing
description:
The origins of Evergreen Farm is not an uncommon one for the midwestern family farm. With family deeds to the property dating back to the mid-1800s, the farm was once thriving with a 10+ acre orchard, "truck patch" for produce, and 225 acres of farmland. We were one of the first farmhouses in the area with indoor plumbing and electric lights(evidence of both remains).

Back then everything was built with a very specific purpose and built to last. For instance, the building our brewery/taproom is starting in was a wash house. It's the oldest outbuilding on our property and was built to house a gas-powered washing machine for washing clothes. The basement was often used as a cellar for storage and later on held beer brewed by my Great Grandfather Albert Sommer(shown harvesting corn).

Like many other small family farms, the time finally came when 225 acres wasn't enough to support itself in the modern farming market and we sold off most of the fields in 1994. Moving back to the farm in 2017, I began to wonder if there was a way to continue the small farm tradition that had been built over five generations. With conventional farming out of the question and craft niche markets taking off, I decided to look into the idea of a farmhouse brewery and it stuck!

As the brewery continues to grow we plan to provide space to get outside and explore the farm with a cold glass of beer. We also continue to add specialty crops for use in our brews. The goal is to provide not only excellent beer, but also a direct connection to the farming it originates from and make the whole process viewable "From Ground To Growler!"

name: Industry Brewing Company
description:
Liquor production in Peoria began in 1837 – even before the area was incorporated as a city! In the early 1900s, nearly 1/5 of the nation’s liquor was produced in Peoria. By 1917, local distilleries were turning out more than 62 million gallons of alcohol.

Over 100 years later, Industry Brewing seeks to bring Peoria back to its roots – liquor. We strive to create something Peoria and its residents can be proud of by taking something simple – a beer… and putting our own spin on it. We bring the “Whiskey City” a product like no other in a unique and vibrant setting that completes your dining experience.

Our terminal facilities are accessible 24/7. In addition, self-service fueling is available 24/7. Assisted service is typically provided from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, Monday through Friday.

The airport has a multitude of benefits such as low gas prices, no landing fees, and no short-term tie-down/parking fees. Feel free to use the provided courtesy car or take advantage of the free coffee, popcorn, pilot lounge, wireless access, and vending machines.

Located in the heart of Peoria’s Warehouse District, owner Travis Mohlenbrink has created a quick-casual dining experience that is unrivaled in central Illinois.
 Its name is Sugar.
Visual and palate pleasing, Sugar’s menu is inspired by traditional wood fired ovens.  Fired by locally-sourced hardwood, the menu features gourmet pizzas, sandwiches and a variety of other delectable dishes.  We also offer the tasty sweet treats people have come to know at Travis’ other restaurants, Cracked Pepper, Thyme and Cayenne.  The menu is completed with hand-crafted Artisan beer and a wine selection offered by the glass and bottle.
From the moment you step into Sugar, you’ll notice something completely different.  We are counter service, meaning you will be greeted by a friendly staff member at the counter, ready to take your order.  After your order has been placed, you will then receive a number to take to your table and we will deliver the food to you. While you dine, you will notice our restaurant incorporates the use of all repurposed material and LED lighting that has been inspired by the “Green” movement.  This, along with an open-kitchen and a view of the wood fired oven, creates an atmosphere that completes the dining experience.

name: Good Tequilas Mexican Grill- Bartonville

Today, through his hard work, he now owns and operates three local restaurants in the greater Peoria area. But he doesn’t take the credit for his success; rather, he points to the customers for their kindness and support of his dreams and his restaurants. He encourages others to visit Peoria and take advantage of the tools and resources available for entrepreneurs throughout the community.

description: Springdale Cemetery, founded in 1857, was part of the Rural Cemetery Movement that took cemeteries out of the control of the church and created non-denominational, architecturally designed burial places that were also attractive parks with ponds, forests, roads and paths that followed the natural contours of the land and nurtured native and exotic trees and plants. Before the widespread development of public parks, these cemeteries provided a place for all the people to enjoy refined outdoor recreation amidst art and sculpture previously available only for the wealthy

With steep hills, flat sections, mature trees, bridges, creeks and even a tunnel, this is one of our favorite hikes. The views (especially in the Fall) are beautiful. There are four access areas so it is possible to thru-hike or section hike.

Camp Wokanda (northern trail terminus)

Robinson Park at Mossville Road (mid trail access)

Green Valley Camp (mid trail access)

Detweiller Park (southern trail terminus)

name: Curvy Chic Boutique
description:
Curvy Chic boutique is a space designed for women with curves to shop for fashionable clothing that makes you feel great! If you are anywhere between a size 12-26.

We want you to come into our store feeling welcomed. Know that we carry clothes that will fit you and are up to date with current trends. We pride ourselves on providing excellent customer service. When you shop with us you will be greeted with warm welcomes, complete honesty, and as much or little styling assistance as you want. Our goal is to provide our customers with clothes that make you FEEL as beautiful as you already are and to take the stress and struggle out of shopping. 

You should never have to settle for boring, outdated clothes just because you are "plus sized". Curvy Chic is owned and operated by a plus-sized woman, and we understand the struggles of finding cute stylish clothes when you are over a size 12. We are here to put an end to the struggle and let the world know that just because we are plus-sized does NOT mean we don't want to look cute!

description: Peoria // Jose Barragan moved to Peoria over 20 years ago, from Michoacan, Mexico. When he arrived, he brought with him dreams of owning and operating his own restaurant one day. And so, Barragan began his career in food service as a dishwasher at a local restaurant, learning the trade for several years and dedicating his life to hard work and dedication in pursuit of his dreams. Today, through his hard work, he now owns and operates three local restaurants in the greater Peoria area. But he doesn’t take the credit for his success; rather, he points to the customers for their kindness and support of his dreams and his restaurants. He encourages others to visit Peoria and take advantage of the tools and resources available for entrepreneurs throughout the community.

Farmdale also hosts a sweet downhill run, a MTX/dirt jump course, and a freeride/stunt section. Farmdale regularly hosts races in the I74 Race Series, as well as the annual PAMBA fall festival.

name: Golf Learning Center and Academy
description:
Peoria Park District’s all-weather heated and lighted driving range recreates golf course hole layouts.  Indoor and outdoor practice greens, indoor hitting stations, and a 9-hole pitch and putt course.

Both experienced golfers and beginners can agree that the Golf Learning Center is a very useful, unique aspect of the Peoria Park District’s golf portfolio. The Golf Learning Center offers lessons for all age ranges and skillsets, as well as indoor putting and hitting stations, an all-season driving range, and par 3 pitch-and-putt courses. Be sure to also check out the pro shop for your golf equipment and accessory needs!

Amenities: Birthday Parties, Classes, Food, Memberships, Public Restrooms, Rentals, Shopping

name: Childers Eatery- Grand Prairie
address: 5201 W. War Memorial Drive Suite 260 Peoria , IL 61615
description:
If you’re from Central Illinois, it’s hard to remember a time when Childers Eatery wasn’t feeding the hearts, souls and stomachs of Peoria-area diners. Serving for over 45 years, join us any day of the week at one of our establishments.

We’ve always offered great food and service at affordable prices, so what’s new? Well, for starters, we grow organic fruits and vegetables on-site, at our University location, for the ultimate in wholesome freshness. We are constantly revising our menu to offer tried-and-true classics, new twists on old breakfast and lunch favorites and trendy creative new dishes. From the classics to new trends, we offer everything you love – and the new dishes you’ll start to crave.

name: Aunt Dena's Bakery
description:
We specialize in great cookies, pies, bars, cakes for all occasions, cake balls and pops, and various snack items. We also offer ham and turkey sandwiches made on our white or whole wheat bread. We make our sweet hot pickles and barbeque mustard. We also serve a chicken salad wrap or a chicken salad sandwich. In cold months we make and sell soup Monday-Friday.

Everything is made from scratch here in our bakery. We specialize in made-to-order.

name: Cup of Canton
description: Cup of Canton is a family run business. We offer home baked goods and delicious aromatic coffee.

name: Hillcrest Golf Center Inc
description: Hillcrest Golf Center is nestled in the heart of Washington, Illinois. Hillcrest is a cherished staple of the community providing a simple yet beautiful course for individuals of all ages. The course is beautifully laid out to provide the golfer with ample challenges utilizing the entire bag of any golfer.  Well manicured greens and surprises around every corner, makes this course one to ensure you will not be disappointed. Hillcrest also offers a driving range and golf lessons.

name: East Court Village
description: Whether you're in town for the annual Marigold Festival or playing disc golf at a local park, you have to make time for shopping at East Court Village. Located at 3500 E. Court Street, East Court Village is a major shopping hub in Pekin, Illinois and Tazewell County. Anchored by Tractor Supply, PetCo, Hobby Lobby, and Dunham's Sports - the center is a landmark of the greater Peoria retail market. Pekin, located just 10 miles south of Peoria, has been home to the shops at East Court Village since 1972. Shadow anchored by Super Wal-Mart, Menard's, Big R and Staples, this regional power center is located along busy Illinois Route 9, connecting Pekin to Peoria and Bloomington. Shoppers can enjoy a variety of food options offered at East Court Village including Starbucks, Bob Evans, Culver's, Applebee's, Steak 'n Shake, and more. At East Court Village, we have everything you need for your everyday activities, shopping, and dining. With easy access from Veteran's Drive, East Court Village is highly visible to the 35,000 vehicles passing by the center daily. At three-quarters of a million square feet, it is sure to have what you're looking for.

name: Jimbos Jumbo
description: Give Mom a break and bring home some  Jimbos Jumbo! They have great Italian food including a variety of Italian sandwiches, pizza, pasta, wings, fresh salads and appetizers. Take out, delivery and limited dining in are available. Call ahead for friendly no wait service and quick delivery. They have a 10% Student, Senior, and Military discount.

name: Jo-Ann Fabric and Crafts
address: 4700 N University St Suite 34 Peoria , IL 61614
description: Jo-Ann Fabric and Crafts has all of the essential supplies you may need for every DIY project. Find fabric, sewing supplies, quilting materials, paper products, arts and crafts supplies, and more! Spark your creativity with a wide selection for every craft need.

Allegiant Airlines also has nonstop flights to six popular leisure destinations! You can easily connect to the world from Peoria International Airport.Stop in for breakfast, lunch or dinner in this restaurant with branches on both the land and air sides of the terminal. Enjoy sandwiches or grilled foods, as well as a full service bar.

name: Henry Brown Lodge
address: 3819 N Prospect Rd Peoria Heights , IL 61616
description:
Henry Brown Lodge # 22 P.H.A. was named after the Rev. Henry Brown (1823-1906) was an African Methodist Episcopal preacher in Springfield, Illinois. He worked in various capacities for the Abraham Lincoln family and led "Old Bob," the Lincoln family horse, in President Lincoln's funeral procession.

He also was involved in the Underground Railroad, according to his State Journal obituary on Sept. 4, 1906

Henry Brown Lodge # 22 F.& A. M. P.H. A. was organized in 1871.

We offer 2-week free trials and welcome people to drop-in and check us out!  Open M-F, 5 a.m.  - 6:30 p.m. and Saturdays, 8 a.m. - noon.  We also offer student, military, law enforcement, and teacher discounts.

name: Charmaine's Pet Spa
address: 5901 N Prospect Rd Suite 101A Peoria , IL 61614
description: At Charmaine's Pet Spa, we are dedicated to making your pets feel as comfortable and pampered as possible! Our one at a time scheduling method insures that there will be no barking dogs or other distractions to keep your pet from enjoying their spa services. We play soothing music specifically designed to calm pets, as well as using a "mellow pet" essential oil in our aromatherapy diffuser in the grooming room. Several of our clients have compared our salon to a human spa! The quiet and calm atmosphere is great for all dogs, but can be especially beneficial for puppies getting their first groom, senior pets that need some extra TLC, or dogs that are hyper-reactive to loud noises or other dogs. We offer a variety of grooming services. Please stop in or give us a call!

description: The Washington Recreation Trail connects many areas of town with hiking and biking trails. The trail system features 11 miles of concrete and asphalt surfaces, making it a great recreational amenity for the community and an ideal alternative means of transportation to a variety of community resources and destinations.

Their growing community of 3,438 builds upon its unique character and heritage. They are working to cultivate the local culture and invest in the quality of life amenities to attract and retain new residents and develop a niche in the regional community.

The other room is more of a multi-purpose room where food can be served. The exercise facility has weights, tread mill, stair stepper, and other pieces of fitness equipment.

description: Pekin // Jose Barragan moved to Peoria over 20 years ago, from Michoacan, Mexico. When he arrived, he brought with him dreams of owning and operating his own restaurant one day. And so, Barragan began his career in food service as a dishwasher at a local restaurant, learning the trade for several years and dedicating his life to hard work and dedication in pursuit of his dreams. Today, through his hard work, he now owns and operates three local restaurants in the greater Peoria area. But he doesn’t take the credit for his success; rather, he points to the customers for their kindness and support of his dreams and his restaurants. He encourages others to visit Peoria and take advantage of the tools and resources available for entrepreneurs throughout the community.

name: Christ Orchard
description: Christ Orchard in Elmwood, IL is a family-owned and operated Pick-Your-Own apple orchard and pumpkin patch. Christ Orchard has been family owned and operated for nearly 30 years. The Midland Coal Company planted the orchard in the 1970s and asked the Elmwood FFA to manage it. Kurt Christ was integrally involved in the operation and upon graduation, he began renting the orchard from the coal company. He then bought the orchard in the mid-1980s. The orchard has grown to include not only U-Pick apples but also U-Pick pumpkins, fresh pressed apple cider, fall decorations, mums, fruit preserves and much more.

name: Garden Spot Vegetable Farm
description:
Garden Spot Vegetable Farm is a fruit and vegetable grower. We have 34 acres of produce and about 700 fruit trees. We also do Express Baskets, which are a more flexible type of CSA.

34 acres of organically raised fruit and vegetables. Over 700 fruit tree's. Blackberry and raspberry patch of well over 3000 plants.

We also have asparagus and rhubarb in spring. We sell produce from April 15th-Christmas.

name: Silver Dollar Tavern

Whenever the mood strikes, we have some of the very best bartenders around town, to quench your thirst with an endless variety of mind-bending concoctions.

Our in-house cook makes delicious comfort food and meal combos you won’t find anywhere else! Come in and have a bite anytime!

Pull up a bar stool and grab a cold beer, unique cocktail or chilled glass of wine.

name: City of Metamora
description: The City of Metamora is a vibrant, fast growing community that offers a rich history. Located between Peoria and Bloomington with easy access to jobs and premiere medical facilities, residents get a small town feel with big city amenities.

name: Knuckles Pizza & Sports Bar
description: This pizza spot has been serving Quad City-style pies for over a decade. Here the pies are cut in long strips making it stand out against the rest. The dough is the star of the show, made fresh daily and blended with dark brewers malt. Try one of their many specialty pizzas like the Knucklehead.

name: Farmington Township Park

There is also a basketball court and tennis court as well as a softball diamond. Other amenities include a restroom and extensive playground equipment for all ages. A new disc golf course was constructed in 2017.

name: Holland's Mercantile

name: Cutter's Grove Park
description: Located on the southern edge of Princeville, Cutter’s Grove is the largest park in Princeville. The semi-wooded area boasts a fully lighted baseball field for evening & nighttime games. Covered picnic areas make for great family reunion locations or large gatherings. The large playground and open green space make Cutter’s Grove Park a great destination for a family outing.

name: Elmwood Palace Theater
description:
The Palace Theater in Elmwood has provided fun, family entertainment in central Illinois for over 100 years. The Palace Theater shows many first-run films at a fraction of the cost of the large multiplex theaters. Admission is just $5. 

The Palace Theater in Elmwood, IL started as a vaudeville theater in 1913. It seats around 200 people, features a balcony and is decorated in the art deco style of the 20s & 30s.

description: Pumpkin farm, apples and much more!

name: Arrowhead Country Club
description: Arrowhead Country Club is a family oriented private club located 9 miles north of Peoria just off Route 40. Arrowhead offers golf, swimming, fishing, camping and picnicking on over 200 acres of rolling countryside, lakes, and streams.The current 18-hole golf course was begun in 1961 with the back nine completed ten years later in 1971. Watered fairways were added in 1981. In the spring of 2003 a new, state-of-art, irrigation system was completed. Members may join a variety of golf and swimming organizations along with enjoying a full calendar of social events. The two story clubhouse overlooks the ninth green and the adjoining lakes providing a pastoral center for member activities.

name: Helms Park
address: 10 E Duncan Mills St Lewistown , IL 61542
description: This is a small park located just off Spoon River. The trees and open grass area provide a scenic view of the area.

name: Pekin Riverfront and Miller Parks
description: Hikers can expect a paved riverfront path and trailhead access to Pekin Park Trail. The Pekin Riverfront—which includes Festival Plaza and has an event meadow—is the southernmost stop on the Greater Peoria Canoe and Kayak Trail. Kids will absolutely love the steamboat themed playground and splash pad. It’s a beautiful spot to have a picnic, play horseshoe, or just enjoy the wildlife. Dogs are welcome in this four-acre city park on the Illinois River, and it’s right next to Miller Park with five-acres of fun including boat ramp, picnic grills and shelter.

name: Embellish Salon & Day Spa
description:
Embellish, a sleek and very modern salon offers coloring stations, make up studio, great Aveda products and access to special refreshments for our customers. We offer more than your average salon as we are a destination for hair designs, pampering at the day spa and are connected to Unum Lounge for a perfect ending to your experience.
​

name: Comfort Inn and Suites - Morton
description:
5 minutes from Peoria on I-74. Meeting space with free high-speed Internet. Outdoor garden area seating for 200. Free hot breakfast buffet daily. Suites, oversized rooms with refrigerators, wet bar, irons and iron boards, blow dryers in all rooms. Indoor pool, Jacuzzi, Work out room and lounge. 5 minutes from Par-A-Dice Casino, Eastside sports Complex, Civic Center and Festival of Lights. RV & Bus parking Toll free number (800) 897-7769
